title: SPSFC SEMI-FINALIST REVIEW: All The Whys Of Delilah’s Demise, by Neve Maslakovic
content: For the past few months, we’ve been reading six more semi-finalists from the inaugural SPSFC. Today we’ve got the penultimate full review of these six, which is of Neve Maslakovic’s All The Whys Of Delilah’s Demise. This book has an SPSFC rating of 5.00 out of 10, and is reviewed here by my co-judge Ryan.

}" data-image-title="spsfc-delilah" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://atboundarysedge.files.wordpress.com/2022/02/spsfc-delilah.jpg?w=199" data-large-file="https://atboundarysedge.files.wordpress.com/2022/02/spsfc-delilah.jpg?w=230" src="https://atboundarysedge.files.wordpress.com/2022/02/spsfc-delilah.jpg?w=199" alt="" class="wp-image-4157" srcset="https://atboundarysedge.files.wordpress.com/2022/02/spsfc-delilah.jpg?w=199 199w, https://atboundarysedge.files.wordpress.com/2022/02/spsfc-delilah.jpg?w=100 100w, https://atboundarysedge.files.wordpress.com/2022/02/spsfc-delilah.jpg 230w" sizes="(max-width: 199px) 100vw, 199px" />

I was excited to read this book, because that title is catchy—the perfect kind of title for a book about brands and popularity. This book is a murder mystery following the death of Delilah, who had been the most popular person in New Seattle.

New Seattle’s entire system is based around how popular you are, with the most popular people getting the best housing and the top ten (or Tenners) getting the ability to govern the city. The least popular, well, get exiled out of the city, and don’t survive long. Delilah’s death kickstarts a chain reaction among the city and Scottie ends up trying to solve the murder.

Probably my favourite bit about this is Scottie’s AI companion, named Watson because Scottie really, really likes Sherlock and pretends to be Sherlock while solving the crime. It was a small but consistent character beat that I enjoyed; of course it made me really want to re-read my Sherlock Holmes collection.

I feel like the wrong person to review this. This is a case of a book simply not clicking with a reader. I can absolutely see people interested in these dynamics of popularity (along the lines of the Nosedive episode of Black Mirror.) really enjoying this book, and I do hope it finds an audience.

Once again I would like to thank Ryan for his reviews of our semi-finalists. This last book really was one that fell into the wrong group of reviewers, and it could easily have performed better with another group.

This also marks the end of our semi-finalists, as the one book we have remaining to review has made it through to the final seven books in the whole competition. I’ll be back soon with that, and a full breakdown of the SPSFC Finalists.

author: {ID=9.8758233E7, avatar_URL=https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/8e50661f9c7f374694dc3b71d6334638?s=96&d=identicon&r=G, URL=http://megsmagicalmusings.wordpress.com, site_visible=true, last_name=Hibbitts, first_name=Meg, email=false, login=mphtheatregirl, ip_address=false, name=mphtheatregirl, nice_name=mphtheatregirl, site_ID=1.04248145E8, profile_URL=https://en.gravatar.com/mphtheatregirl}
title: The Paris Library Review
content:
This was my 5th book I finished this year, but my first new book.

Paris, 1939: Young and ambitious Odile Souchet has it all: her handsome police officer beau and a dream job at the American Library in Paris. When the Nazis march into Paris, Odile stands to lose everything she holds dear, including her beloved library. Together with her fellow librarians, Odile joins the Resistance with the best weapons she has: books. But when the war finally ends, instead of freedom, Odile tastes the bitter sting of unspeakable betrayal

Montana, 1983: Lily is a lonely teenager looking for adventure in small-town Montana. Her interest is piqued by her solitary, elderly neighbor. As Lily uncovers more about her neighbor’s mysterious past, she finds that they share a love of language, the same longings, and the same intense jealousy, never suspecting that a dark secret from the past connects them

Goodreads

Based on a true story, but historical fiction. This is the 2nd book I read about the power of literature during WWII. The only difference is that The Paris Library focuses on two different time periods, and the book makes it easy to tell them apart. It is true that there were librarians that showed a LOT of courage during such a horrific time period- they helped soldiers and Jews during this time period through the power of books. Books were such a comfort to many subscribers and soldiers.

Don’t forget such The Holocaust, Jews were forbidden to go to certain places- like the library. So, we have these librarians who would deliver their books- despite the danger they were putting themselves in.

Some of these characters were real- if you read the very end, you will know who was real and who wasn’t. The ones who work at the American Library in Paris were doing everything they can to keep it open. A book about the power of literature, incredible friendship in the most unlikeliest of places, sacrifice, and explores the consequences of our actions.

title: 15/5/22 – finish with nothing
content:
Ok it’s a bit late but I’m not going to leave you hanging all day. This is coming from a Thameslink from Luton to Blackfriars after a morning walk around Dunstable Downs.

Last night we were out in picturesque Markyate, first watching the FA Cup Final in one pub, then a curry and then a pint in a little local craft pub until we decided we probably didn’t need to drink any more.

Quadruple: still on. 2/4 complete. The final itself ended goalless after extra time, although quite how is a bit of a mystery with multiple strikes against woodwork, some good saves and a load of shots dragged past the far post from both teams. The penalties went to round 7, when the Greek Scouser, Tsimikas his own self scored his after I think Mount had had one saved. So Chelsea finish with nothing and how sad that is.

It was also the Eurovision Song Contest, which we didn’t watch, but which Ukraine won, surprising no one but pleasing just about everyone. So that’s good. And somehow the UK finished second.

Anyway so I’m on a train home and then to decide how to spend the afternoon. There is football to watch I guess. We’ll see.

author: {email=false, name=Scattered Thoughts, avatar_URL=https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/8a707d608bac5c26b97fb0e35fa2b66e?s=96&d=identicon&r=G, login=melaniemarshall, site_visible=true, URL=http://scatteredthoughtsandroguewords.com, ID=2.9601995E7, first_name=Melanie, site_ID=3.0032227E7, ip_address=false, profile_URL=https://en.gravatar.com/melaniemarshall, nice_name=melaniemarshall, last_name=Marshall}
title: Review: Egotistical Puckboy (Puckboy #1) by Eden Finley and Saxon James
content:
}" data-image-title="img_0471" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://scatteredthoughtsandroguewords.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/img_0471.jpg?w=197" data-large-file="https://scatteredthoughtsandroguewords.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/img_0471.jpg?w=673" src="https://scatteredthoughtsandroguewords.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/img_0471.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-73357" />

Rating: 4.75🌈

As the hockey teams are making their run for the Stanley Cup in real life, I had just finished one hockey series and was in need of another when this got my attention.

Egotistical Puckboy, the first in Eden Finley and Saxon James’ Puckboy series about hockey players getting their HEA. Needless to say, I’m in.

I so enjoyed this enemies to lovers romance about two egotistical fantastic NHL hockey players. The long time feud, fueled by misconceptions about each other, including one’s sexuality, is so well written.

The bigger than life personalities of both D-man Ezra Palaszczuk and winger Anton Hayes, huge egos to match their vast athletic talents on the ice, it’s all there on the page for the reader to love, cackle at, and ,yes, swoon over, as they warily stumble their way into a relationship and romance.

Authors Finley and James are careful that, when crafting this novel , all the important elements are brought in so it feels believable and a world we should want to invest ourselves into.

The games! The way the men fly across the ice, bodies moving, puck flashing, it’s pure awesomeness. It’s hockey! You can see these games and ,when or lose (they do both), you feel the emotional impact with them.

The men themselves are layered, their pasts, their passions, their pain.

Ezra Palaszczuk is someone who appears one dimensional, on purpose, but only as a barrier to hide the damage done by negligent , borderline abusive parents and the toll it continues to take on him.

Anton Hayes has his own personal issues to work through and it’s his relationship with Ez that allows him the different perspective to start on a new path and journey.

This story has so many great aspects to it. It’s a dynamic hockey book. It’s a sexy romance. It’s a thoughtful conversation about gay athletes in a major sport (see fabulous The Queer Collective element), what it means for queer youth to have representation. It’s also about knowing yourself well enough that you’re finally comfortable and feel safe to come out .

Like I said. There’s so much to Egotistical Puckboy (Puckboy #1) by Eden Finley and Saxon James. I love this. And I’m highly recommending it.

There’s a second story out. I’m onto that next.

It’s hockey season. Enjoy!

Puckboy series:

Egotistical Puckboy #1

Irresponsible Puckboy #2

https://www.goodreads.com › showEgotistical Puckboy – Goodreads

Synopsis:

EZRA

Partying, dudes, and hockey. What more could a gay NHL player want?

If it weren’t for Anton Hayes, my life would be perfect.

Not that he affects my life in any way. At all. That would imply I care what the winger from Philly thinks of me.

Which I don’t.

Not even a one-night stand with him can thaw his misplaced animosity toward me.

He says I’m the one with the ego, but he can talk. He rivals me for most egotistical puck boy in the league.

I hate him as much as he hates me. Even if I crave a repeat.

ANTON

When it comes to hockey, I’m all about the game.

I’ve worked for years to be one of the best in the league, and l’ve done it without splashing my orientation all over the tabloids.

My hockey image is one I’ve carefully cultivated, and after one night with Ezra Palaszczuk, I risk it all.

He’s cocky, obnoxious, and has an ego bigger than Massachusetts. And okay, maybe he’s the sexiest man I’ve ever known.

We’ll never get along. Not when we sleep together. Not even when my possessive streak awakens.

That doesn’t stop us from falling into bed together over and over again.

author: {first_name=Charles, login=aloysius5, ip_address=false, ID=2.8067865E7, site_visible=true, email=false, URL=http://aloysius5.wordpress.com, site_ID=2.853277E7, profile_URL=https://en.gravatar.com/aloysius5, avatar_URL=https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/5eae41863db1bd0acc0fc19682c4f2bb?s=96&d=identicon&r=G, last_name=Heath, nice_name=aloysius5, name=aloysius5}
title: The cinema of my dreams – I always wanted to write a war story – Episode 18
content:
For a story that was conceived during those long boring hours flying in a steel cocoon, striving to keep away the thoughts that the plane and everyone in it could just simply disappear as planes have in the past, it has come a long way.

Whilst I have always had a fascination in what happened during the second world war, not the battles or fighting, but in the more obscure events that took place, I decided to pen my own little sidebar to what was a long and bitter war.

And, so, it continues…

 

It was clear, however, that Marina was familiar with the man and very annoyed with the woman.

When I took a longer look at the man, I realised he was not a man at all, but a boy in his teens, blessed by the fact he looked older than he was.  My guess, about 16.  I was surprised he had not been conscripted into the war, there seemed very few young men in the area.

Marina went straight over to him and snatched the elderly rifle he was holding away from him, the glared at Chiara

“Are you stark staring mad.  Enrico is not supposed to be out in the open, hell, it’s been a battle to keep him hidden away.  What will his parents think when they discover he’s here?”

“Pleased,” Enrico said.  “My father said it’s about time I did something to rid of the Germans, of the English too for that matter.  None of you has any right to be here.”

Fervently spoken, and to the wrong person, it would earn him a bullet to the back of the head.  But I agreed with him.

“All well and good,” Marina said to him, “but now there’s no easy way of doing that.  We must be careful, and you must stay put with your parents.  What we’re doing isn’t a game, you are neither trained or equipped to take anyone on, except perhaps rabbits.”

Back at Chiara.  “Take him home, and never bring him back here.  You don’t want to be the one who has to tell his mother if he gets killed.  Now, both of you go now, before I shoot both of you myself.”

“This is not the end of the matter,” Enrico said.

“And when you’ve taken him back, come back here.  We need to talk.”

Chiara said nothing, just nodded sullenly.  I think she believed the less said the better and did as she was asked, nodding her head in his direction, and adding a few choice phrases in Italian to him that I couldn’t understand.  It also just occurred to me that she had not asked Chiara the questions about the two men from the castle.  I guess that would have to wait until the safety of Enrico was settled, and she returned.

“Make sure they’re safe,” she said to Carlo, and he disappeared, leaving us alone.

“I thought all of the young men had been taken away by the Italian Army.”

“Not all.  We managed to hide a few away, but as you can see, despite our best efforts, they don’t seem to appreciate the trouble they could get into.  We used to have about a hundred young men from 14 through to 20 at the start of the war.  Two have found their way back, casualties of war, the rest, we may never see them again.  Enrico just doesn’t see the trouble he could get into.”

“It’s called youthful enthusiasm.  In the first world war, joining up, or going to war, was a lark.  It was a little less so this time because most of the parents knew from firsthand experience what it was like and tried to shield them.  And if you didn’t join up, questions were asked, and quite often jail, except for some who landed cushy jobs away from the fighting.”

“You were not so lucky?”

“No, I was one of those mad buggers who thought joining up to fight would be an adventure.  That quickly faded when the enemy started shooting at me.”

“And now you’re here, and a spy to boot.  That’s what they’ll hang on you if you get caught.”

“Then I shall try very hard not to get caught.  Again.”

 

Chiara came back about an hour later.  It seemed to me it was a lot safer to move around at night with the blackout, and I doubted Thompson would spare any men from the castle to check up on the local farmers.

And while I was at the castle, I didn’t hear anything raised about the local resistance, which I thought odd at the time, but now I knew why.  Most of them had joined him.  Better that than be hunted down and killed.

Chiara still looked sullen.  A closer look showed she was not very old herself, barely out of her twenties, and surprising that the Italian army, or Thomson for that matter, had not rounded her up for ‘duties’ at the castle.

There were a number of the local women working up at the castle, but they were mostly staff, or more likely forced labour, though I had thought we, when I believed it to be a British outpost, would be fairer to the locals than either the Germans or their own Italian military.  It’s odd how you tend to look at certain situations because of who you are, and the fact you would not do similar things at home.  The Germans, however, we would always treat differently, because they were the enemy, and because we expected the worst from them.  At that moment, though, wouldn’t the Germans think the same of us if the positions were reversed?

Best not to think about that.  My view of the war and the people in it was clouded enough.

Chiara, however, clearly thought the worst of me, and of those in the castle, and certainly didn’t think I was as neutral as I appeared.  A gun always in hand, I was sure she would shoot me again with the least provocation.

We sat, both Chiara and Marina with their weapons on the table in front of them.  I wasn’t trusted enough to be given a weapon.

Marina’s first question was directed at Chiara, “I’m told there were two men from the castle following Sam, and that he told you about them.”

“He did.  We did not see them.  We didn’t take the path, because, as you know, it’s not safe.”

It was a reasonable answer.  If the men at the castle were unfamiliar with the area, as I’m sure they would be, because they hadn’t been there for very long, and I doubt Thompson would want to advertise the nationality of those at the castle unless he had to, they would stick to the clearly-marked roads and paths.

I had on my way to the castle, from a different direction.  It didn’t explain why I had not been met by the leader of the resistance as arranged, but that was now explained, both by the former leader trying to kill me in a roadside explosion, and then what I learned at the castle in the last few days.

“Even so, there’s not that much distance between the two, and it is possible to shadow them.”

“I keep well away from them.  Perhaps Leonardo saw them.  He doesn’t have to worry about what they might do because they use him to supply food.  Maybe he knows more.”

“Perhaps I shall ask him next time I see him.  We need to know who from the castle is about and when so that we don’t get caught.”

“I’ll remember next time.  Is that all?”

“Yes.”

Chiara picked up her gun, gave me an extra-long sullen stare.  “I don’t trust this one, Marina.  You 

need to be careful.”

“I will.”

We waited a few minutes until after she had departed, and then Marina said, “We should be going too.  This place is a little eerie at night.  There are far too many ghosts for my liking.”

I shuddered, then followed her out.

 

© Charles Heath 2019

}" data-image-title="shadow gate" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://thegreentealibrarian.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/shadow-gate.jpg?w=186" data-large-file="https://thegreentealibrarian.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/shadow-gate.jpg?w=635" data-id="5721" src="https://thegreentealibrarian.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/shadow-gate.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-5721" />

I just finished The Last Wish by Andrzej Sapkowski.

Shadow Gate is book two in the Crossroads series by Kate Elliott. It is quite thought-provoking although at times not a very pleasant to read.

On the other hand the much lauded The House in the Cerulean Sea by TJ Klune is a cinnamon roll of a read.

The Wicked Deep by Shea Ernshaw is atmospheric and interesting if your fantasy tastes are leaning more spooky but not too scary.

Dragon Prince by Melanie Rawn is the only book in this series that I’ve reread and I still love it. The second half does take on hard topics, including rape. Our characters are put through the wringer. It might be my favorite Melanie Rawn book (and this series is finished if you wanted to challenge yourself).

title: Character Quotes from Shakazhan ~ A Futuristic Romance by Dellani Oakes
content:
}" data-image-title="Shakazhan front" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://booksandentertainmentnetwork.files.wordpress.com/2022/02/shakazhan-front.jpg?w=194" data-large-file="https://booksandentertainmentnetwork.files.wordpress.com/2022/02/shakazhan-front.jpg?w=384" src="https://booksandentertainmentnetwork.files.wordpress.com/2022/02/shakazhan-front.jpg?w=384" alt="" class="wp-image-14795" srcset="https://booksandentertainmentnetwork.files.wordpress.com/2022/02/shakazhan-front.jpg 384w, https://booksandentertainmentnetwork.files.wordpress.com/2022/02/shakazhan-front.jpg?w=97 97w, https://booksandentertainmentnetwork.files.wordpress.com/2022/02/shakazhan-front.jpg?w=194 194w" sizes="(max-width: 384px) 100vw, 384px" />

Wil focused his eye on the beast, searching for the most vulnerable target. Motioning the others back, Wil took a few steps forward. The cat lowered its head, eyeing him with both anger and hunger. Wil’s feral grin spread slowly as he faced down his foe. His lip twitched in a snarl of his own.

“That’s right, you big pussy. Come and get me,” Wil growled as he crouched.

The cat snarled, glaring at the puny human crouching in front of it like wounded prey. Shaking its head, it roared the challenge, revealing a second set of teeth.

“You must have a hell of a dentist bill,” Wil quipped. “Come get me, bad boy. Your mother’s a carpet!” He bellowed. “You’re gonna look great on my floor. Come get me, you walking trophy!”

It didn’t really matter what he said, it was the defiance in his voice that he counted on.

“Come on….” he urged quietly.

The big cat circled, making up its mind. Wil saw a flicker of decision in the large, amber eyes.

title: Blacksmith’s Heart ~ A Love Under the Sun Romance by Dellani Oakes ~ Part 12
content:
}" data-image-title="Blacksmith’s Heart cover" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://dellanioakes.files.wordpress.com/2022/03/blacksmiths-heart-cover.jpg?w=215" data-large-file="https://dellanioakes.files.wordpress.com/2022/03/blacksmiths-heart-cover.jpg?w=733" src="https://dellanioakes.files.wordpress.com/2022/03/blacksmiths-heart-cover.jpg?w=107" alt="" class="wp-image-6697" srcset="https://dellanioakes.files.wordpress.com/2022/03/blacksmiths-heart-cover.jpg?w=107 107w, https://dellanioakes.files.wordpress.com/2022/03/blacksmiths-heart-cover.jpg?w=214 214w" sizes="(max-width: 107px) 100vw, 107px" />

“No! No, Hana! I can’t do this. I won’t!”

“I know,” she agreed quietly. “I know. I wanted you to touch me. I’m sorry, I shouldn’t have.”

“I think maybe I should take you to your cabin,” he said awkwardly. His voice sounded tight and strained.

“Yeah, nothing would kill the mood quite as fast as being reamed by Aunt Enid. Oh, if she could see me now!”

“She’d probably be less shocked than you think,” he grinned. “You did hear the story of how she met Ed, didn’t you?”

“Yes, she invited him to take a bath with her in the pond.”

“Uh huh. And did she say anything else?”

“Nothing specific— Oh!” She remembered what Enid had said in passing. “We didn’t exactly bathe, that’s what she said. Oh!”

Jasper was chuckling. “Don’t ever tell your mother, she’d have a heart attack.”

“I’m sorry, I’m just—stunned. She was just about my age when they met.”

He nodded, chuckling. “And your uncle was built like a Greek god, did she tell you that?”

“She said his butt was so tight, she could bounce a quarter off it.” Hana paused a moment, then took his hand. “Thank you.”

Jasper sat beside her, holding her hands. “For what?”

“For making me stop and think,” she said quietly. “For making me realize that it’s you I’ve been waiting for all this time. I think Aunt Enid knew. I think she’s been trying to bring us together for a while, but the time was finally right.”

“Why now? Why not a year ago, or two years?”

“I don’t know. I guess we’re both finally ready.”

“I’d better take you home now,” he said, putting his arm around her waist. “Or I’m going to forget my own advice and start kissing you again.”

“It will happen when the time is right, Jasper.”

He nodded, hugging her with one arm. “Let’s get you home. Your aunt’s going to burn a trail up and down my spine, if I keep you out too late.”

They walked back to her cabin, holding hands, talking about inconsequential things. Just being together was enough, they didn’t even have to speak. Both fell silent when they reached the cabin.

Jasper embraced her, holding her close. Hana put her arms around his waist, hugging him tightly. He leaned over and gave her a chaste kiss on the cheek, intending to leave. Hana turned her head to meet his lips, daring him to pull away from her. There was a challenge in her that he couldn’t deny, and he let his lips fall on hers.

I can stop. I can stop kissing her, turn and walk away. Anytime now. Anytime I want. But he couldn’t. He felt himself falling into her, wrapping her around him like a warm, soft quilt.

The porch light clicked on, startling them both. Hana wiped her lips with the back of her hand and ran fingers through her hair. Jasper shoved his hands in his pockets and backed away a step from her.

“Night, Hana. I’ll see you in the morning. We’ll plan our day at breakfast, okay?”

“I’d like that,” she nodded. “Night, Jasper.”

He kissed her hand, letting it go reluctantly. As he walked away, the door behind Hana opened slowly.

“I thought I heard voices out here,” Aunt Enid said with a sly grin. “Did Jasper leave?”

“Yes, Auntie, he left. Subtle.” She chuckled and flicked the light switch. “Yet it made the point.”

“Oh? What point?” she tried to sound and look innocent, then lost control and started to laugh. “I’m sorry, Hana. It’s me being an old busy body. If the boy gets what he wants right off, then you haven’t got the fun of being pursued.”

They walked back into the cabin together. Hana turned off the porch light and locked the door.

“Did Uncle Ed pursue you?”

“He had to.” She chuckled as she remembered. “I ran off with his clothes.”

“Is that what happened when he joined you in the pond? You ran off with his clothes?”

Enid’s eyes took on a dreamy, faraway look. “He was the best looking thing I’d ever seen. He’d been watching me most of the day, following me around and snapping pictures wherever I went. So when I went to bathe, I knew he’d be there and I lured him in. He wanted to fool around of course, but I wasn’t about to do that. Instead, I got him all lathered up with soap, ducked him under water and when he was trying to get the soap out of his eyes, I jumped out and grabbed his clothing.

“I ran off with his things, and he had to follow me, butt ass naked until he caught up with me. I let him, of course. I could have outrun him, because I had a hell of a good head start. He stayed in the pond a while trying to decide what to do. Once he made up his mind, he caught up fairly quickly. It was funny as hell watching him run after me with his hands over his privates.

“After he apologized for stalking me, I gave him his things back. We hung out the rest of the day, listened to the bands and enjoyed one another’s company. He didn’t try to touch me again, until I gave him permission, and that wasn’t until we’d been dating a while. A man needs to know his limitations, and it’s up to us to give them to him. I’ve often said the woman is stronger than the man. God made him a lustier being. Of course, if men weren’t so damn persistent, the human race would have died out a long time ago.”

“If they weren’t so damn gorgeous and sexy, then we wouldn’t fall all over our tongues and slip in the drool either.”

© Dellani Oakes 2022

title: Writer’s Desk: Choose the Right Words
content:
}" data-image-title="image-1" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://chrisbarsanti.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/image-1.png?w=195" data-large-file="https://chrisbarsanti.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/image-1.png?w=600" src="https://chrisbarsanti.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/image-1.png?w=600" alt="" class="wp-image-14375" srcset="https://chrisbarsanti.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/image-1.png 600w, https://chrisbarsanti.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/image-1.png?w=98 98w, https://chrisbarsanti.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/image-1.png?w=195 195w" sizes="(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px" />

In 1988, Nobel Prize-winning poet and onetime Soviet dissident Joseph Brodsky gave the commencement speech to the University of Michigan. In the wide-ranging address, he dispensed an array of life’s wisdom, including be nice to your parents and avoid putting too much trust in politicians.

More to the point, he reminded his audience to choose their words well:

Treat your vocabulary the way you would your checking account.

title: Saturday Snippet – Ineptitude
content:
Heya Lovelies,

Here’s Day 14 of Fantasy Indies May:
Saturday Snippet — Ineptitude

Featuring Enduring The Flames

Hunted.

A low chuckle escaped Vlad’s throat.
“Brought down by tripping in the dark.”
“Well, aren’t you funny?” I drawled, not caring
how sharp my accent was in that moment.
“A little help?”

The vampire crouched and eased me into a
sitting position, which elicited a sharp hiss
from me as more pain shot through my chest.
When I was steady, he released my shoulders
and the uncomfortable silence stretched on.

“You aren’t going to continue making fun of
me for my brilliant display of ineptitude?”

An amused grunt was my only response.

© Sarah Doughty

Sarah

title: Wineries and Cideries in Grand Bend, Ontario and Surrounding Area
content:
If you are looking for a wine tour, wine tasting, or are planning an event in the Grand Bend area here are some options for you to choose from. Grand Bend, Ontario is a beautiful and quiet area with many beautiful wineries to choose from.

In my previous blog “The Perfect Getaway in Grand Bend, Ontario” I discussed a couple of the wineries that are in the Grand Bend area. I have created this map to assist in planning your perfect getaway. Grand Bend is surrounded by beautiful farmland, vineyards, and orchards. With this map you can create your own wine tour around the Grand Bend area.

Most of the wineries included are located close to beautiful Lake Huron allowing for an opportunity to visit the beach and the vineyards in the same trip.

Use this to map out your trip to the Grand Bend area with short country road travels between locations. All locations included provide a unique experience that is affordable. Shale Ridge offers the instagram experience, while Dark Horse provides a more classy and sophisticated environment. Grand Bend has a variety of options for a winery experience that ensures anyone can find what they are looking for.

Enjoy your wine experience in Grand Bend and and share your experiences in the comments!

title: THE BLUE CITY:JODHPUR
content:
Hey guys!I hope you all are doing fine!
So I went to Jodhpur on Thursday night ie. 8 August 2019 by train (Mandore Express) with my family.
We reached Jodhpur on Friday morning at 8:00 am and then reached our hotel. Our hotel was Indana Palace. It was such a beautiful hotel that literally took our heart.

Day 1

So, after getting fresh, we went to have ourbreakfast in the Angithi Restaurant in the hotel premises.
Then after resting for nearly 3-4 hours,weleft our hotel at 2:00 pm and went to Jaswant Thada. It’s a really beautiful place with a  lot of greenery. The wind was in its full swing and the sun was too bright.

After exploring Jaswant Thada, we went toMehrangarh Fort. It’s such a huge fort with lots of beautiful scriptures. It had a detailed history of the kings and queens. The Fort contained their swords, dresses, ornaments and other fighting equipments. From inside the Fort, one gets to view the “BLUE CITY” from above. It was such a breathtaking site.

Then we returned to our hotel in the evening and had our snacks. After resting for a few hours, we had our dinner in the Angithi Restaurant. Then, we went to sleep

DAY 2After having our breakfast, we hired an auto and decided to visit different places at a fixed price. So after having a discussion with the driver, we went to our first destination, Umaid Bhavan Palace.

The palace was converted into a hotel, so we were not allowed inside the hotel, but it had a museum so, we went there. The museum was based on the history of kings of the palace. There, we also got to see some vintage cars which were in display. They were really awesome!

Then after having lunch, we went to Balsamad Lake but couldn’t get to see it because the lake was inside a hotel and only the hotel guests could get to see it. Sad!Then, we went to Mandore Garden. It was a  really huge garden with temples, museum, lake and restaurants.

Then we went to have or lunch from a traditional Jodhpuri restaurant. The food was really delicious.
After having our lunch, we went to the Machia Biological Park. It was basically a zoo. I got to see a variety of animals including Asiatic lion, cobra and many more!

Later on, we went to Kaylani Lake. It was a vast lake and had motor boat rides. The wind was so swift and the view was mesmerising.

DAY 3After having a heavy breakfast, we took off to the local market and did some shopping. The market was really inexpensive. We bought clothes, artefacts, decoration items and sweets.
Then we had our lunch and went back to the hotel. We packed our stuff and went to the station for our train. Our train was scheduled at 7:45 pm to took off. We waited for some time and then boarded train. We reached Delhi at 7:30 am. We booked our cab and reached home.
So, this was all about my trip to Jodhpur. I hope you all will definitely visit Jodhpur if you haven’t yet!
Till then,
Take care,
Byee!

title: UNRAVELLING UDAIPUR
content:
Hey Everyone!
I hope you all are doing fine!

I went to Udaipur in October,2015 with my family. We took train from Delhi to Udaipur in the evening and reached the next morning. We went to our hotel and rested for few hours.

In the afternoon, we went to Lake Pichola. It was a very beautiful lake and weather was also very pleasant.

After visiting Lake Pichola, we went to Fateh Sagar Lake. It was such a mesmerizing lake. We also did Boat riding.

The next day, we went to City Palace which was so beautiful. We spent the entire day exploring the amazing Palace and the City Palace museum. Then, we went back to our hotel.

The next day, we went to Chittorgarh Fort. It is such a huge fort that we managed to see only a small part of it.

So, this was about my trip to Udaipur. I hope you all enjoyed it! So, plan a trip to Udaipur super soon!!

Until, Next Time!! 

Byeee!

title: Leaving on a jet plane
content:
George W. Bush Intercontinental Airport, Houston, Texas, USA-

First post! I’m gonna confess that I spent about 5 minutes trying to figure out how to start this post, but I figure I’m gonna get straight into it. As I write this, I’m sitting in Terminal C just around the corner from Gate 42, where I’m scheduled to fly to Washington DC-Dulles at noon.

For those of you who are just tuning in, or don’t know me and Helen personally, this is the tl;dr for why this blog exists- We got accepted into the National Security Language Initiative for Youth program, Helen for Russian and me for Arabic, and we’re going to be blogging about our experiences for students back home who might be interested in studying abroad. We’ll try and keep up with this as best we can, but there may not be a regular post schedule and quite a bit of time may pass between posts, due to the nature of our programs. Anyway, back to the airport.

This is my first time flying completely solo, and I’m honestly less apprehensive about it than I thought I’d be. There are some minor inconveniences, like not being able to just leave baggage with someone to go use the restroom or to go get a snack, but I’m liking the independence. I suppose I’ll have plenty of time to get tired of it over the next six weeks, if I ever do. The airport is completely packed, and the prices are somehow worse than I expected. It cost me 15 bucks for a sad slice of pizza and a tiny salad.

I’m also feeling just a bit sad that I’m going to miss out on one last summer before college with my friends. Of course, I know that this is an opportunity of a lifetime, but it still aches a bit. I’m leaving on a jet plane, but at least I do know when I’ll be back again.

However, that’s all tempered by the excitement I’m feeling. I’m pumped to finally meet my program cohort and to be back in Washington DC, and to finally visit the State Department! The next few days are going to be pretty insane, but I’m ready for it.

That just about wraps it up for now, I think. It’s time for me to get ready to board the flight to DC. Cheers!

title: Annecy – Venice of the Alps
content: The untouched places of France

}" data-image-title="61453312-4a36-485a-8baf-505639a2563d_1_201_a" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/61453312-4a36-485a-8baf-505639a2563d_1_201_a.jpeg?w=300" data-large-file="https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/61453312-4a36-485a-8baf-505639a2563d_1_201_a.jpeg?w=1024" data-id="94" src="https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/61453312-4a36-485a-8baf-505639a2563d_1_201_a.jpeg?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-94" srcset="https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/61453312-4a36-485a-8baf-505639a2563d_1_201_a.jpeg?w=1024 1024w, https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/61453312-4a36-485a-8baf-505639a2563d_1_201_a.jpeg?w=2048 2048w, https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/61453312-4a36-485a-8baf-505639a2563d_1_201_a.jpeg?w=150 150w, https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/61453312-4a36-485a-8baf-505639a2563d_1_201_a.jpeg?w=300 300w, https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/61453312-4a36-485a-8baf-505639a2563d_1_201_a.jpeg?w=768 768w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" />

Description : What’s the first thing you think about when you hear the word “France”?. Well isn’t it the Eiffel Tower? I hope I guessed it right! Well France luckily is not only about the Eiffel Tower, cheese, wine and baguette, I am introducing you to this wonderland called as “Annecy”, and for all the right reasons it’s called as the Venice of the Alps.

From narrow cobbled-stoned streets to the canal running through the lanes , it is no less than a paradise. If you ask me, it definitely is my most favorite travel destination. If you are a mountain person and a lake person, then it would be your cherry on the cake.

The mountains are covered with snow during winters and during summers, the skies dance in the shades of blue. It’s close proximity to Switzerland makes it one of the most beautiful regions to visit in France.

If you are planning your trip to France, then this HAS to be added to your bucket list and trust me you won’t regret it.

How to get there :

By air/ train

  1. Annecy is located 50 km from Geneva International Airport (Switzerland). There are direct train and bus/shuttle connections to Annecy from the airport.
  2. Annecy is 125 km from Lyon Saint-Exupéry International Airport (France). There are train and coach connections to Annecy from the airport.

By motorway

  1. Closest cities : Geneva (42 km) or Lyon (146 km)

What to do :

I would suggest that a 3 nights and 4 days trip to Annecy is sufficient to explore the city and its surroundings. Here are some tips on what you can explore in Annecy:

  1. Guided tours : There are a number of guided tours available in the tourism office. They will cost you around 6.50 Euros per adult. Children entry is free.
  2. Explore Old-Annecy – Enjoy walking in the lanes by yourself at your own pace, discovering the little cobbled-stone roads and local markets.
  3. Picnic in the garden near Lac’ Annecy. Immerse yourself in the goodness of fresh air and a fantastic view as you picnic in the gardens of the lake. A fabulous way to relax and de-stress yourself from the real world.
  4. From pedal boat to water-skiing and wakeboarding you will find a number of activities that will keep you entertained.
  5. Chateau d’Annecy – You can add this to your do to list when you visit Annecy. A quick access from the old town, you can delve into history and enjoy some French culture.
  6. Geneva – Thanks to its close proximity to Switzerland, while you are enjoying your stay in Annecy, you can also plan your one day trip to Geneva, which is just about 40-45 minutes away by car and about 45 minutes – 1 hour by train.
  7. Chamonix (Mont Blanc) – Chamonix hosts the highest mountain in Western-Europe! YES, that’s right! This town is a winter wonderland and has cable car services from the city to Mont Blanc to explore breathtaking views! It takes you to The Aiguille du Midi and this cable car holds the world record for the highest vertical ascent: 2807m (from 1035m to 3842m). This is the closest you can get to the Mont Blanc on a lift system. It is approximately 1 hour away from Annecy by car. You can also explore other ways to get there by train or shuttle bus.

}" data-image-title="2a67ea4f-ec2f-44ce-a88d-41880eb36485" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/2a67ea4f-ec2f-44ce-a88d-41880eb36485.jpeg?w=169" data-large-file="https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/2a67ea4f-ec2f-44ce-a88d-41880eb36485.jpeg?w=576" data-id="95" src="https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/2a67ea4f-ec2f-44ce-a88d-41880eb36485.jpeg?w=576" alt="" class="wp-image-95" srcset="https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/2a67ea4f-ec2f-44ce-a88d-41880eb36485.jpeg?w=576 576w, https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/2a67ea4f-ec2f-44ce-a88d-41880eb36485.jpeg?w=1152 1152w, https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/2a67ea4f-ec2f-44ce-a88d-41880eb36485.jpeg?w=84 84w, https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/2a67ea4f-ec2f-44ce-a88d-41880eb36485.jpeg?w=169 169w, https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/2a67ea4f-ec2f-44ce-a88d-41880eb36485.jpeg?w=768 768w" sizes="(max-width: 576px) 100vw, 576px" />

}" data-image-title="d903077d-da6e-4e4a-894d-49cb9d26875e" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/d903077d-da6e-4e4a-894d-49cb9d26875e.jpg?w=225" data-large-file="https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/d903077d-da6e-4e4a-894d-49cb9d26875e.jpg?w=768" data-id="100" src="https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/d903077d-da6e-4e4a-894d-49cb9d26875e.jpg?w=768" alt="" class="wp-image-100" srcset="https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/d903077d-da6e-4e4a-894d-49cb9d26875e.jpg?w=768 768w, https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/d903077d-da6e-4e4a-894d-49cb9d26875e.jpg?w=1536 1536w, https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/d903077d-da6e-4e4a-894d-49cb9d26875e.jpg?w=113 113w, https://shreyadailytravel.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/d903077d-da6e-4e4a-894d-49cb9d26875e.jpg?w=225 225w" sizes="(max-width: 768px) 100vw, 768px" />

Things to eat :

Annecy has a number of little restaurants, sandwich shops, ice-cream parlors that you can indulge in! Here are some of my recommendations to you:

  1. Raclette Sandwich – This definitely goes on the top of my list. Raclette is a type of Swiss-cheese you can find in the small sandwich shops in Annecy. You can order various types of sandwiches such as ham or only cheese. The sandwich is decorated with warm raclette cheese on top with the popular French baguette.
  2. Cheese board – You can order a cheese board in any restaurant and find number of different cheese on the platter such as reblochon, beaufort, abondance, chevrotin, raclette. A wonderful way to taste the region’s speciality.
  3. Ice-cream – I am definitely an ice-cream lover! One of the very famous ice cream shops in Annecy is the Glacier des Alps (opened in 1966). It has a variety of flavors that you can choose from.

I hope you enjoyed my little guide to Annecy, France. This is my first ever written blog and I hope I keep delivering you more and more insightful content! And as the French say it

A la prochaine !

Untouched places of France.
What’s the first thing you think about when you hear the word “France”?

title: Kamandag Beach Adventure
content:
}" data-image-title="kaman1-1" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://orlyumali.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/kaman1-1.png?w=300" data-large-file="https://orlyumali.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/kaman1-1.png?w=1024" src="https://orlyumali.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/kaman1-1.png?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-58" srcset="https://orlyumali.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/kaman1-1.png?w=1024 1024w, https://orlyumali.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/kaman1-1.png?w=150 150w, https://orlyumali.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/kaman1-1.png?w=300 300w, https://orlyumali.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/kaman1-1.png?w=768 768w, https://orlyumali.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/kaman1-1.png 1920w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" />

Good things about Kamandag Beach

Very few people visit this area, especially on weekdays. If you really want to escape the business of urban living, this is one place where you will get to enjoy personal silence and music from the sea. You can practically do anything you want here without worrying that others will be disturbed. You Can Set up your bonfire and make quality time with relatives and friends.

The place is quite clean thanks to responsible campers and visitors. The view is great, especially the sunset. Fishing is great in the morning but you have to walk to reach a nice fishing spot near Puerto Azul. Trevallies, groupers, and checkered snappers are the common species you can catch.

From Kamandag beach you can also take a boat ride to other locations. Kayukno beach is a favorite. Carabao island in Maragondon is another. The ride will cost you from 250 pesos to 500 pesos depending on the number of destinations you want to visit. Generally, Kamandag beach is a budget destination. But it is not free.

Not so Good things about Kamandag Beach

Well, it is not a beach resort. So you will not find the comfort offered by a regular resort. There is no comfort room. No stores to buy food and drinks from. There is no shower room where you can take a bath after swimming on the shore. When you decide to go swimming, do not go barefoot. The stones are sharp and shells can give you cuts. 

My Recommendation

Kamandag beach may not be free and does not offer the comfort you will find in beach resorts in the area but it is still a good place to go. The site is ideal for friends, groups, and families who want to enjoy a budget-friendly place near the sea. Just do not forget to bring your own tent, especially food and water. Camping and fishing are truly enjoyable here.

Inspired by vloggers with fishing content on YouTube, we figured it would be fun to do some camping and fishing. After […]

title: Learning to Fly
content: August 22, 2021-November 7, 2021 Seoul, South Korea

}" data-image-title="img_6310-1" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/img_6310-1.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/img_6310-1.jpg?w=1024" src="https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/img_6310-1.jpg?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-437" width="300" height="225" srcset="https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/img_6310-1.jpg?w=300 300w, https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/img_6310-1.jpg?w=600 600w, https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/img_6310-1.jpg?w=150 150w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px" />

Photo by S. Lee

My first time abroad, flying alone, traveling alone.. All of those things can be said of this trip. It was not an adventure experienced without obstacles, all of which I will come to later.. but it was a learning experience. Before that, let’s start at the beginning.

Years before this solo trip came to be, I began studying the Korean language and culture. Through this, I found my path in life. That isn’t to say that path has not since been altered by recent revelations, but I digress. I had attempted several times to study abroad, and each time I was met with resistance which told me it was not the right time. Five slow years later, an opportunity presented itself. Granted I did work diligently to create that opportunity.

}" data-image-title="E8E0CAB3-97CD-49A3-AD36-F83D834D21B9" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/e8e0cab3-97cd-49a3-ad36-f83d834d21b9.jpg?w=240" data-large-file="https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/e8e0cab3-97cd-49a3-ad36-f83d834d21b9.jpg?w=819" src="https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/e8e0cab3-97cd-49a3-ad36-f83d834d21b9.jpg?w=819" alt="" class="wp-image-327" srcset="https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/e8e0cab3-97cd-49a3-ad36-f83d834d21b9.jpg?w=819 819w, https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/e8e0cab3-97cd-49a3-ad36-f83d834d21b9.jpg?w=120 120w, https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/e8e0cab3-97cd-49a3-ad36-f83d834d21b9.jpg?w=240 240w, https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/e8e0cab3-97cd-49a3-ad36-f83d834d21b9.jpg?w=768 768w, https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/e8e0cab3-97cd-49a3-ad36-f83d834d21b9.jpg 1440w" sizes="(max-width: 819px) 100vw, 819px" />

Since Covid 19 was still raging rampantly, I had to prepare even more documents, medical supplies, and information than the usual trip would require. That is saying a lot, as I am also Type 1 Diabetic; as life would have it, I constantly have to be prepared for whatever might happen. The years I spent being a planner came in handy, and both my flight and check in for quarantine went more perfectly than I could have conjured. I spent two lonely weeks in a government quarantine facility, which was really just a posh hotel where I was served three meals a day, and transported for free via shuttle upon my dismissal. Thankfully I was not left to fend for myself after leaving quarantine. I had been planning for months to meet someone whom I consider my closest friend, and so I was so graciously provided with someone to rely on.

I suppose that means I did not travel entirely alone, but the majority of my time was spent trying to adapt to my new surroundings. There was a lot to process, and to be honest I am not sure I have yet to accomplish that task. I had planned for three months in Seoul, South Korea, but amid the tourist attractions, meeting a few friends and eating everything I could try.. my health was beginning to betray me. Surprisingly, my woes did not have much to do with Type 1 Diabetes, at first. Before departing for Korea, I was diagnosed with Diabetic Retinopathy, which is nerve damage to the eyes caused from T1D. My doctor assured me we had caught it early and I was still very capable of continuing on with my plans. Because of that, I had amazing experiences that I could never forget; as long as I write it all down.

}" data-image-title="img_6214-1" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/img_6214-1.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/img_6214-1.jpg?w=1024" src="https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/img_6214-1.jpg?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-448" srcset="https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/img_6214-1.jpg?w=1024 1024w, https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/img_6214-1.jpg?w=150 150w, https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/img_6214-1.jpg?w=300 300w, https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/img_6214-1.jpg?w=768 768w, https://anonymousbluej.files.wordpress.com/2022/06/img_6214-1.jpg 1792w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" />

This was not to be the end of my concerns, nor the most frightening thing I experienced while abroad. After the wisdom tooth extraction, I became dangerously ill. My tonsils were swollen so extremely that I could not breathe, I was dehydrated and my throat felt like I swallowed glass. At this point, we made the decision that I needed to be in an emergency room. This was a feat in and of itself, because with covid restrictions, no one had room or either they could not risk that what I was experiencing was covid. Finally, at 2 am in the morning a small hospital admitted me after I tested negative for covid. They gave me fluids and did their best to ensure I was in no danger of my airways closing, but they were afraid to keep me due to my T1D diagnosis.

I went home, hoping I would be okay. Regretfully, I ended up at the ER again because I could not breathe, and my fever was persistent. I thought maybe the wisdom tooth issue had turned into a more serious infection. After several tests and a scan of my lungs and airways to ensure I was not septic or in danger of an abscess, the doctor at the second ER cleared me to fly. I had to make the heartbreaking choice to return home and treat this mysterious illness. I was later given instruction to visit a large university hospital for treatment, but in the end I knew I needed to return home. While preparing to leave, I was terrified I would not be able to fly due to fever and other symptoms. Somehow I made it through more than 20 hours of travel time, and was soon admitted to the ER in the United States.

After miraculously making it home, and being admitted and tested in the ER, I was finally told that I had contracted a terrible case of a virus unrelated to covid 19. I spent several days in the hospital, and during this time I was left with my thoughts of being forced to return from my trip of a lifetime. I never quite recovered mentally from that aspect, and I knew even before the sickness and before returning home that I would depart for Korea once again in the near future.

the journey will continue…

A WordPress.com website.
excerpt: August 22, 2021-November 7, 2021 Seoul, South Korea Years before this solo trip came to be, I began studying the Korean language and culture. Through this, I found my path in life. That isn’t to say that path has not since been altered by recent revelations, but I digress. I had attempted several times to […]

title: 4 BEST MOUNTAIN Bikes Under $700
content:
Mountain biking is like any other sport. You get what you pay. My experience with cycling has shown that the more money you spend, the better the equipment will be. There is a sweet spot. For a solid entry-level mountain bike, that’s between $600 to $700. The 4 best mountain bikes for under $750 in my opinion are the Marlin 5 from Trek at $569, the Talon 2 By Giant at $620, and the Cannondale 7 at $675. For $650, you can get the Specialized Rockhopper Sport for $650.

I think the price range of $600-$700 is my sweet spot. It’s still a mountain bike for less than $1,000, but it’s not the most affordable. This means that you get an entry-level bike with some upgrades.

Before we jump onto the bikes, let us discuss other factors that helped me reach this point.

WHY DO THESE BRANDS WORK?

There are many mountain bike brands, but these are the five most well-known brands in cycling. All of them offer high-end bikes at a competitive price. Trek, Giant, and Specialized offer bikes at very affordable prices with the highest quality components. All of these brands offer bikes at competitive prices, so you should ask which type of mountain biking trails you’ll use.

WHAT KIND OF TRAILS WILL YOU BE USING?

It is important to consider the type of trails that you will be riding on when choosing a mountain biking bike. Not all mountain bikes are equal. There are four main types of mountain bikes to choose from Cross Country, Trail, and Downhill.

Each mountain bike is made differently. Cross Country bikes are lighter, more efficient, and designed for climbing. Trail mountain bikes have suspension, tires, and brakes that can handle the downhill. Downhill bikes are built for tough terrain and the obstacles of any downhill section. The all-mountain/enduro bikes can climb but not as well as Cross Country and trail bikes. However, they excel at the downhill section.

These bikes are all trail bikes. However, there are some cross-country bikes that are within this price range.

WHAT DIFFERENCE IS THERE BETWEEN TRAIL AND CROSS COUNTRY BIKES?

Many people don’t know that there are many types of mountain bikes when they purchase their first mountain bike. We will be defining the two types that we are discussing in this article. Many of you know that I was unaware of the different types of mountain bikes until I started researching them to help me decide what one I wanted. This article will focus on trail and cross-country mountain bikes.

When people say “mountain bikes”, they think of trail bikes. This mountain bike is versatile and can be used on both trails and the roads. Trail bikes have better suspension than cross-country bikes, larger tires for better grip, and greater stopping power. These bikes are designed to be efficient but also allow for flat and downhill riding. A trail bike that is well-built will provide a smooth, efficient ride up. However, it doesn’t mean it will be easy. You will be able to handle steep corners and stop quickly with the brakes.

Cross-country bikes are designed with efficiency in mind. They are not designed to climb down mountains, but rather to climb them. Cross-country bikes can also handle downhill rides depending on their difficulty. They are not designed for downhill riding and have a weighted priority.

Both cross-country and trail bikes are equally important in this industry. A bike that is capable of functioning at all levels is what I prefer. If I need a more specific bike, I’ll search for it.

Before we begin, let’s note that all these bikes come with tektro hydraulic braking.

The 4 Best Mountain Bikes Under $700

Here is the list of best mountain bikes under 700 dollars :-

TREK MARLIN 5

}" data-image-title="rockhopper-sport-29" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://obikeride.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/rockhopper-sport-29.png?w=300" data-large-file="https://obikeride.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/rockhopper-sport-29.png?w=1024" src="https://obikeride.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/rockhopper-sport-29.png?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-55" srcset="https://obikeride.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/rockhopper-sport-29.png?w=1024 1024w, https://obikeride.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/rockhopper-sport-29.png?w=2048 2048w, https://obikeride.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/rockhopper-sport-29.png?w=150 150w, https://obikeride.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/rockhopper-sport-29.png?w=300 300w, https://obikeride.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/rockhopper-sport-29.png?w=768 768w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" />

The specialized Rockhopper Sport is today’s final bike. This bike is the best on the list, except for its weight. Although the Rockhopper bikes were traditionally heavier for their purpose, Specialized may have made the bike lighter in 2021. Even though it’s a heavier bike, this bike is still one of our favorites.

Also Read: 5 Best Mountain Bikes under $1000 – Reviews 2022

SUMMARY

The top five bikes are capable and reliable. These bikes are great for beginners and intermediate mountain bikers. You might also want to consider the bigger brothers. There are more expensive models that are designed for serious riders. These bikes are a great choice if you’re concerned about price. You can also modify the bike as soon as you have the money.

title: Exquisite Gourmet Experience with Emirates Palace’s Restaurants
content:
After going walking on the beach while enjoying the salty-sweet wind or having a relaxing day at the spa, what better way to complete your perfect day than to dine in a good restaurant.

Emirates Palace, which has the finest global cuisine, offers you a unique experience beyond compare with their choices of restaurants.    

Le Café

Experience the full majesty of the Hotel by visiting Le Café, located beside the regal fountain, where diners can choose from their array of sweet courses and treats, including their 24K dipped soft-serve ice cream cone – Ice Gold.  

Of course, a must-try for this cafe is their one-of-a-kind, special drink called “Emirates Palace Special Cappuccino” that’s topped with delectable gold and decorated with the creamiest milk and espresso.

Martabaan by Hemant Oberoi

If you are looking for authentic, classical, true aficionado Indian cuisine, then dine in Martabaan of Emirates Palace. This fine-dining restaurant is known for its contemporary classic Indian dishes by Hemant Oberoi – a celebrated master, and the first Indian chef nominated to the world gourmet club, who is recognized for his innovative approach to Indian cuisine.

Martabaan will give you an aristocratic dining experience as well as the visual treat of an oft-loved yet forgotten classic presented in an innovative way.

Indulge in the dishes displayed in the two-set and main menus such as the Paneer lal mirch (barrels of cottage cheese marinated with yogurt and turmeric, stuffed with tomato and mint chutney, and grilled in a clay oven), Martabaan ka meat/chole (tender lamb/chickpeas slowly cooked with red chili pickle, onion, and tomato-based curry), Murg malai tikka (creamy chicken tikka cooked in tandoor), decadent chocolate shawarma, Varqui Crab, and Masala Chai Crem Brulee.

BBQ Al Qasr

Looking for a restaurant with a romantic ambiance? Then BBQ Al Qasr is the restaurant you’re looking for.

BBQ Al Qasr is known as the most romantic restaurant in Abu Dhabi that features a romantic, elegant, yet casual dining experience under the stars on the beach as you enjoy a variety set of divine food grilled to perfection by the sea made from the best ingredients from all around the world along with your soul mate. The gentle sea and the soft breeze are accompanied by the best searing steaks and seafood.

Hakkasan

Overlooking the opulent grounds of the majestic Emirates Palace and the stunning Abu Dhabi skyline lies the Hakkasan Terrace which is a restaurant that features innovative drinks, cocktails, and bottle service paired with dedicated small plates and dishes.

Enjoy a relaxing evening of drinking and dining as you view the sublime cabanas overlooking the city skyline.

Vendome

If you are looking for a buffet that has refreshing al fresco dining, then Vendome is the perfect restaurant for you.  

Vendome offers local and international best dishes from the middle east while weaving an array of international favorites, presented with precise attention to detail and made using the seasonal and freshest local produce. It offers a luxurious dining experience to guests of all ages.

Cascades

Craving for the feel of Greece? then try out Cascades – a Greek-inspired restaurant that is situated beside the cascading waterfalls and sea grottos, overviewing the breath-taking view of the azure Arabian Gulf.

This family-friendly restaurant is perfect for a sunny day of pool and beach-side relaxation while enjoying a hearty meal of family-sized dishes of seafood, entrée, and deserts with a special children’s menu for in-house guests. 

Talea by Antonio Guida

Lastly, if you’re looking for dishes from the motherland of pasta, then head on over to the newly opened Talea, a restaurant that offers a highly curated selection of seasonal and authentic Italian menus in an elegant yet lively setting with a vibrant open show kitchen for diners to enjoy.

This restaurant is acclaimed by the two-Michelin-starred Antonio Guida, which is his first restaurant outside of Italy. Enjoy Emirates Palace restaurant’s menus as they offer different cuisines and features that will cater to your tastes. Dine in the restaurants of your choice as you enjoy the full luxury experience with Emirates Palace Hotel.  Don’t forget to book with Supper Club ME membership.

author: {name=Pragya Singh, first_name=Pragya, last_name=Singh, profile_URL=https://en.gravatar.com/adwordps, site_ID=2.06833135E8, site_visible=true, ID=2.21708877E8, login=adwordps, email=false, URL=http://writershubcoin.wordpress.com, nice_name=adwordps, avatar_URL=https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/04d981bc40e698f24fcd95246c00065f?s=96&d=identicon&r=G, ip_address=false}
title: One night at a Hostel
content:
Recently, I made a brief trip to Delhi and booked a hostel named “Zoho”. It was located near the railway station, at a very accessible location. 

The hostel had such a unique twist. It was a hotel before, and they renovated it and gave it a modern touch, with quirky interiors and some fresh graffiti across the hostel. The graffiti walls across the place and the vibrant pieces of furniture complemented the chic and happening vibe of the area. The two-floor hostel had several dorms with 6 beds each and spacious private rooms with en-suite washrooms offering a 24*7 hot water facility. It also had the option of a female dorm, which I had booked.

title: Where the magic happens..
content:
And no, it isn’t the bedroom 😉 Last weekend I went a few days to Dinseyland Paris with a few friends! I always though that Disney was just like every other themepark, just a themepark. But Disney is different. There is real Magic!

Of course, you can take a picture with Mickey Mouse. But that’s not all! There are shows with fantastic dancers, every attraction is in style and even the waiting lines are even decorated in style! I have to be honest; I wasn’t a really big fan of Disney before I went there. I even haven’t seen all the movies. Frozen is still on the watch list, oeps. Luckily my friends had seen all the movies and could also tell me which movie was which attraction and what the main story was. But I would recommend everyone, when and if you go, watch the movies! It was that my friends have seen them, but otherwise you miss a great part of the stories which are told. It’s not only the themed attractions, but also the shows where they are in. Like the firework show at the end of the day or the parade. Which I both highly recommend. Also a tip, a lot of people want to see those shows and (of course) want a good spot. If you want to be at the front row or at a specific spot, make sure that you are at that spot at least an hour before the show starts. Even then people will already be waiting. At least, that was when I was there.

Furthermore, there are some shows inside. You can make a reservation for those. And because there are limited places, it is logic to make a reservation (and pay for your spot). But here is the same as with the shows outside, if you are on time (like an hour), there will be a place for you and you don’t have to make a reservation and pay. I have to say that we went outside the children’s vacations and at weekdays. I can imagen that it will be busier in weekends and in vacations.

The shows were fantastic! We went to the Lion King show, with a lot of dancers, songs and acrobatic trics. We also have seen Mickey and the Magician. Which was also very nice. A lot of other Disney figures, like Belle and the Beast and Frozen appeared in the show. So that is also nice for little children (who have seen the movies J ). Especially because the language they speak in the show is French and Enligsh, it is a kind of mix, so little children from another country maybe can’t follow the speaking part. In the Lion King show are songs only.

And now, a week back home, I miss the magic. But I am definitely going back some time!

X- Sophie

title: Watching The Port In Angel Land
content:
I’ve seen the young girls
these days.
She will go far and wide,
as the old saying goes.
She has lovely hips.
I wish I had them,
but oh well,
shit is what it is.
We all go on our sailings.
Some stay in port.
I still really love her,
watching her sip her
Mexican soda with a straw
through her lipgloss lips.
I wonder about her journeys
ahead.

title: Detroit Riverwalk spring2022 – Named best in USA! see why
content:
Scroll until the end to view the short film showcasing all it’s beauty in detail!

Detroit Riverwalk has been named Best Riverwalk in the 2022 USA TODAY 10 Best Readers’ Choice Awards contest. It is the second year in a row that the Detroit Riverwalk has been recognized as the Best Riverwalk in the country!

10Best.com provides users with original, unbiased, and experiential travel content of top attractions, things to see and do, and restaurants for top destinations in the U.S. and around the world.

The riverfront redevelopment in Detroit, a city with 14 miles of shoreline along the Detroit River, is one of the city’s most exciting initiatives. The East Riverfront of the Detroit International RiverWalk stretches from Joe Louis Arena to Gabriel Richard Park and includes several parks, restaurants, splash parks and natural areas.

title: Traveling to learn
content:
15 May 2022

Sitting in my office reading chair –– a floral wingback that didn’t quite have a place in my house –– I decide to continue the book I’m reading before resuming grading. Thankfully, I have acquired the skill of reading for pleasure despite a haunting to-do list staring at me from my desk.

In a couple of days we are leaving for our study abroad program, Global Leadership in Thailand, and a passage from Amartya Sen’s memoir Home in the World resonates. He talks about the history of Nalanda University in India, which held classes over 1500 years ago (before Oxford or Cambridge) and was an exemplar of global higher education. Some think Nalanda was primarily the result of trade along the Silk Road, but Sen offers this rebuttal:

“If trade gets people together (and it certainly does), then so does the pursuit of knowledge and enlightenment. Mathematics, science, engineering, music and the arts, along with religious and ethical commitments, have prompted people to seek them across regions, by land and sea, over millennia. The motivation behind these journeys was not the pursuit of commercial gain, but the search for ideas – including, but not limited to, religious ideas. The huge modern popularity of seeing global connections through the prism of trade, of which the Silk Route is a leading example, should not be allowed to eclipse the fact that reflective engagements have motivated the movement of people across countries and regions for just as long. Globalization is the result not only of seeking business, but also of talking to – and learning from – each other.”

I love that phrase “reflective engagements.” It summarizes my perspective nicely. This study abroad trip — and many of the global components of my career — are motivated and fueled by reflective engagement. Something happens in the mind and spirit when we joyfully engage with new ideas, people, and places. Our brains light up and our egos cool down. While COVID has seen a rise in digital engagement around the world (I have meetings in Southeast Asia weekly), I wonder at the impact of the pandemic on our collective ability to learn from the world around us.

Onward.

title: Pulse Grande Hotel, Putrajaya
content:
I wish I could say I enjoyed my stay. Unfortunately, I didn’t.

I was prepared that the place wouldn’t be as gah as it would have been before the pandemic, but I wasn’t prepared for what ensued. The only commendable thing about the whole experience was the staff. The communication skills were superb, but the service and the facilities/layout, whatever you call it, are slowly going down the drain. It would be pretty sad for all these young skilled staff to go just because the place is unable to serve as an exclusive abode for travellers.

So, what could be improved?

Check-in ritual

Taking into account that the lady could be new, I just feel that there is certain information that must be conveyed automatically to the guest. Which should be included as part of the training if you are to man the check-in counter. Such as the WIFI password, breakfast time, breakfast area and highlights of the hotel such as access to the garden park, pool, and directions to the kids club room. I felt that the lady failed to recognize that I actually booked extra service from the hotel which included the birthday room decor and kids package. It would be helpful to advise guests early regarding payment and such activities.

The rooms

My room is on the ground floor because I chose the garden view. Plus point is that it is near the breakfast cafe. The minus points are that you will be walking through the hallway that has public toilets. If they are cleaned regularly, they will not smell. Otherwise, merasalah kau bau hancing sepanjang jalan menapak ke bilik. You could also feel this damp, musty feeling as you walk through the hallway and also as I entered our room. Macam bilik yang tak pernah dapat cahaya matahari sort of thing. Lembap semacam. It is honestly very uncomfortable. The room lighting is also so malap with the switches macam haywire. Like, OMG.. porque? porque?

Not only that, my room is directly beside an open hall area where activities are held. So, be prepared to have people standing outside your hotel room door during the day. It’s like dah kenapa ko bersidai tepi pintu aku.

I was also very disappointed with the gifts that my kids get from the extra room package thing. I mean, how is a puzzle that has a tank at a dataran picture spells out cute for kids? Even if you give a standard, white embroidered towel with cute animals or flowers, the type that they can bring to the pool pun budak akan suka. But puzzle? Who’s great idea is that?

Thankfully, the birthday room decor was ACCEPTABLE although I was like, why is the Happy Birthday balloon decor in black? What happened to happier colours? I would suggest the fruits to be cut up though. Guest bukannya bawak pisau nak potong epal, oren bagai untuk kongsi dengan semua. Please don’t say something like, boleh gigit kan epal tu.. haih.. hempuk jugak lah.

}" data-image-title="wp-1652620698993" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://mincisensei.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/wp-1652620698993.jpg?w=224" data-large-file="https://mincisensei.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/wp-1652620698993.jpg?w=765" src="https://mincisensei.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/wp-1652620698993.jpg?w=765" alt="" class="wp-image-11287" srcset="https://mincisensei.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/wp-1652620698993.jpg?w=765 765w, https://mincisensei.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/wp-1652620698993.jpg?w=1530 1530w, https://mincisensei.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/wp-1652620698993.jpg?w=112 112w, https://mincisensei.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/wp-1652620698993.jpg?w=224 224w, https://mincisensei.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/wp-1652620698993.jpg?w=768 768w" sizes="(max-width: 765px) 100vw, 765px" />

Room service

Room service is supposed to be convenient. People order room service because they do not want the hassle to leave the room to eat. They are willing to pay extra just so they could attend to their matters in the room while having a nice, hot meal. This hotel does not have the usual hard copy menu in the room. Instead, we have to scan a QR code. Only, they did not tell where the QR code is. Jenuhlah aku mencari dlm laci, at the check in card and all for this QR code. Only later did they say they will send the QR code to the room and to call 0 to place an order.

Eh.

Might as well you give me the physical menu and take my order at the door, kan? Tapi takpe.. I will take that QR code, call O and place the order before 930pm. Now, a wait of 30 to 40 mins to me is acceptable but to wait for nearly an hour – is just ridiculous. Lebih me-ridiculouskan is that the staff said they are still busy with the buffet. Well lady, I don’t give a shit. I have kids who is having trouble to stay awake but hungry at the same time.

The food finally came. My initial order was a set of chicken briyani, honey bbq club sandwich, tomato arabiatta from the kids menu, 2 cans of Sprite and 2 additional bottled mineral water. They did not provide me with the mineral water, reason being, there’s already water in the room (masalahnya aku nak extra, and I am paying for it, part mana yg tak faham tu?) My problem with the meal was the spaghetti. They should put a chilli picture next to the menu to indicate the level of spiciness. Since it was under the kids menu, mestilah kita tak expect it wouldn’t be THAT spicy kan? Well no, it was damn spicy. Thankfully, the briyani saved the day.

Final verdict

This hotel has a really nice location. The garden park is wonderful. Cuma tuhlah.

}" data-image-title="wp-1652620336195" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://mincisensei.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/wp-1652620336195.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://mincisensei.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/wp-1652620336195.jpg?w=1024" src="https://mincisensei.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/wp-1652620336195.jpg?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-11284" srcset="https://mincisensei.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/wp-1652620336195.jpg?w=1024 1024w, https://mincisensei.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/wp-1652620336195.jpg?w=2048 2048w, https://mincisensei.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/wp-1652620336195.jpg?w=150 150w, https://mincisensei.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/wp-1652620336195.jpg?w=300 300w, https://mincisensei.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/wp-1652620336195.jpg?w=768 768w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" />

I can imagine it’s majestic reputation at one point in time. I believe it could be what it was once again with time and a bit of improvement to the facility and service. You’ve already got the people. Until it buckles up, I have to say, it is not an option for my hotel stay in the future.

We checked in at 8pm, after hadap terrible traffic on the highway for hours, and I had imagined a night where everything is in place. I imagined a night where I could take my hot shower, hair in a turban, sipping hot coffee at the desk while eating my hot meal and watching TV. I’d imagined the kids be sleeping restfully after the meal while my husband and I have a chat. But no, it did not happen. Room service was so lambat that the kids were already asleep.

ntah berapa kali aku angkat tepon, call for this, call for that.. haih.. stress sangat. I am not paying for 280 per night taw.

I am paying RM360/night with an additional RM120 for decor (&cake) and RM125 for room service meals. Can you sense the disappointment?

In short, don’t waste your money here until you read a better review this year.

title: Let It Brie in Downtown Fullerton
content: I usually blog about afternoon tea rooms, but my lunch at Let It Brie in downtown Fullerton was wonderful and I highly recommend you stop by if you’re in the area. Downtown Fullerton is super cute, walkable and one of the stops for Amtrak’s Pacific Surfliner if you like to ride the train. This is a great little cafe and cheese shop that has been open for 3 years. They have a patio in the back and live acoustic guitar on Friday nights. It’s exactly the type of place you would hope to find in Orange County, California.
