title: Weekend Threesome – 5/15/22
content:
}" data-image-title="possums012" data-image-description="

mama and baby possum

" data-image-caption="

The same patio where I once met these two…

" data-medium-file="https://evilsquirrelsnest.files.wordpress.com/2015/07/possums012.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://evilsquirrelsnest.files.wordpress.com/2015/07/possums012.jpg?w=1024" class="size-large wp-image-6819" src="https://evilsquirrelsnest.files.wordpress.com/2015/07/possums012.jpg?w=640" alt="" width="640" height="480" srcset="https://evilsquirrelsnest.files.wordpress.com/2015/07/possums012.jpg?w=640 640w, https://evilsquirrelsnest.files.wordpress.com/2015/07/possums012.jpg?w=150 150w, https://evilsquirrelsnest.files.wordpress.com/2015/07/possums012.jpg?w=300 300w, https://evilsquirrelsnest.files.wordpress.com/2015/07/possums012.jpg?w=768 768w, https://evilsquirrelsnest.files.wordpress.com/2015/07/possums012.jpg?w=1024 1024w, https://evilsquirrelsnest.files.wordpress.com/2015/07/possums012.jpg 1216w" sizes="(max-width: 640px) 100vw, 640px" />

The same patio where I once met these two…

One of the guys laying the new floor also came out for a smoke break (Which is what the front door’s for, but as I’ve learned from previous remodels, the construction peeps are treated like they have diplomatic immunity).  Anyway, he paced around while making a phone call to…. I’d assume some kind of significant other.  It’s actually rare to only get to listen to one side of a cellphone call these days given how many people use one of those face to face apps, whatever they’re called…

The flooring company he works for is based way out in the sticks of Illinois, and he was wanting her to bring something to him… but was trying to budget for how much gas that trip would eat up.  He advised her to only put a few dollars in the tank at home, which should let her make it to some place down the highway where he said it was 40 cents cheaper a gallon.  But then he had another tip….

“And use cruise control once you get on the highway!” he advised.

One awkward pause later…..

“Not birth control, CRUISE control!”

Thankfully my break was about over at that time, because I needed to get back inside the store so I could laugh like a hyena….

title: Sunday Funnies: May 15
content:
Another installment from my dad’s humor cards.

The backstory: My dad was a Presbyterian pastor for 40 years. He kept a well curated stack of humor cards – little stories or observations that he typed onto 5×7 cards. Then he wrote in the margins when he used that particular item. His humor was often an easy way to settle in to something deeper – by laughing and thinking about the buried truth in these little nuggets, it paved the way to an open heart.

When we cleaned out his desk after he died 7 years ago, I was lucky enough to stumble on this stack. I pull it out regularly to have a little laugh with my dear Dad. Now when I post one of them, I write my note next to his and it feels like a continuation.

Church Bulletin Bloopers

Next Thursday there will be tryouts for the choir. They need all the help they can get.

Barbara remains in the hospital and needs blood donors for more transfusions. She is also having trouble sleeping and requests tapes of Pastor Jack’s sermons.

The outreach committee has enlisted 25 visitors to make calls on people who are not afflicted with any church.

The Pastor would appreciate it if the ladies of the congregation would lend him their girdles for the pancake breakfast next Sunday morning.

Remember in prayer those who are sick of our church and community.

Next Sunday Mrs. Vinson will be soloist for the morning service. The pastor will then speak on “It’s a terrible experience.”

content:
}" data-image-title="dsc_0082" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://cruisin2.files.wordpress.com/2021/10/dsc_0082.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://cruisin2.files.wordpress.com/2021/10/dsc_0082.jpg?w=1024" src="https://cruisin2.files.wordpress.com/2021/10/dsc_0082.jpg?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-25428" srcset="https://cruisin2.files.wordpress.com/2021/10/dsc_0082.jpg?w=1024 1024w, https://cruisin2.files.wordpress.com/2021/10/dsc_0082.jpg?w=150 150w, https://cruisin2.files.wordpress.com/2021/10/dsc_0082.jpg?w=300 300w, https://cruisin2.files.wordpress.com/2021/10/dsc_0082.jpg?w=768 768w, https://cruisin2.files.wordpress.com/2021/10/dsc_0082.jpg 1200w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" />

Fifth grade teacher Sister Agnes was leading her parochial school class in an arts and crafts activity; tie-dying t-shirts. A couple of unruly students were getting a bit reckless with their bottles of dye when they accidentally spilled several ounces of pink pigment down the back of Sister Agnes.
The jaws of every kid in the class dropped as they watched to see how the aging nun would react.

Their amazement only grew as her worn and slightly faded garment repelled any evidence of a stain.

“Holy Mother of God!” one student exclaimed, “it’s a miracle!”

Sister Agnes shrugged and went about her work without concern. “It’s not a miracle,” she replied. “Haven’t you ever heard? Old habits dye hard!”

title: So Many Miles on the Tandem!
content:
This has been the wackiest year of cycling since I started riding in 2011. The weather all spring was ugly and uncooperative and I don’t know anyone up in miles from last year. No one.

That said, the weather has taken a turn for the better and improved significantly to where we’re out in shorts and short sleeves. I’m up to something resembling normal week numbers – after Saturday’s 49-mile ride on the tandem, I was sitting on 177 miles over the last seven days.

In addition, my wife and I have been doing significant work on our marriage and we’re happier together than I can ever remember. That blessing translated even to bike choice. In previous years, we’d either choose single bikes and let the tandem sit, or only ride the tandem on Sunday mornings. We’re choosing the tandem every time we ride together. In fact, after some rudimentary math on the way out on a 50-mile out-and-back route, I realized I’ve got more miles on the tandem this year than I do on the Venge and I wouldn’t want it any other way. Jess and I are actually talking about trading in our Periscope for a new Co-Motion Robusto – a significant increase in quality and a massive decrease in weight. The changes also meant less time for cycling, but the benefits vastly outweigh missing some time on two wheels.

At this point, I’d rather ride with my wife on a tandem. So why not do that on something that would compliment our speedy nature rather than act as a boat anchor? We bought our periscope so that we could have something that would fit a stoker as small as our young daughters, or my wife. With the one of the girls off at college and the other halfway through high school (and neither enjoying cycling), it makes sense to get us onto something that fits us properly.

In the case of my wife and I, a friend loves to say a tandem is a marriage maker, or a marriage breaker. We made our marriage… then brought the tandem to the party. For us, the tandem perfectly compliments where we are at, mentally and physically, in our marriage. The better we’re doing as a couple, the more we enjoy riding the tandem.

I never thought I’d choose a 43-pound boat anchor over a 16-pound aero race bike. But I do, and for that I am grateful.

title: Sunday Funday: Roe v. Wade Won’t Go Away Edition
content:
}" data-image-title="handmaids tale" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://bfiablog.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/handmaids-tale.jpeg?w=300" data-large-file="https://bfiablog.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/handmaids-tale.jpeg?w=526" class="size-medium wp-image-59244 aligncenter" src="https://bfiablog.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/handmaids-tale.jpeg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="300" srcset="https://bfiablog.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/handmaids-tale.jpeg?w=300 300w, https://bfiablog.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/handmaids-tale.jpeg?w=150 150w, https://bfiablog.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/handmaids-tale.jpeg 526w" sizes="(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px" />

For those in the now Trumpinista party who think that if they and their media lackeys simply ignore the upcoming SCOTUS decision that the effects on their election chances will not be effected. Millions of women around the country stood up and said “Hell, No, We won’t forget!” 

Methinks the radical right stuck their hand in a hornets nest full of really mad hornets. Well, as James Carville always says “When your opponent is drowning, throw them an anchor!”

Another interesting week.

A) Near Palm Beach, Florida as an airplane pilot fell unconscious and the plane was landed by a passenger with no experience guided by whom?

B) Instant karma going to get you. Karma came calling in South Carolina where Joseph McKinnon died while doing what?

C) In a real surprise the January 6th Committee subpoenaed five members of what group?

D) Rallies across Iowa and the country took place yesterday protesting what upcoming SCOTUS decision?

E) What really, really rare type of storm for Iowa hit Northwest Iowa Thursday night?

F) Elon Musk started the week by saying he would lift the ban on what individual when he takes over Twitter?

G) By the end of the week, Musk seemed to be looking for an escape clause, pausing his upcoming purchase of  Twitter over what issue?

H) According to an analysis by Brown University , approximately what percentage of adults could have been saved from death had 100% of adults been vaccinated?

I) As the Republican Party internal war rages, Governor Kemp in Georgia picked up what endorsement in defiance of Trump’s endorsements there?

J) WNBA star Brittney Griner’s detention in what country has been extended by a month?

K) Maine senator Susan Collins called police after protestors in front of her house did what?

L) Protestors at Justice Alito’s home were treated to wine and cheese by whom?

M) What Scandinavian country will reverse a long standing policy and apply for NATO membership this weekend?

N) The governor of what state defended policy that would force impregnated incest victims to carry their baby to term?

O) Scientists at the Event Horizon Telescope Collaboration made huge news with a picture of what Thursday?

P) The nationwide manhunt for an Alabama escaped killer Casey White and his prison guard helper Vicky White ended Monday night in what city?

Q) Russia’s ambassador to Poland was attacked with what as he attended a Victory Day (or VE Day) ceremony in Warsaw?

R) In Nebraska, Republican governor candidate Charles Herbster, despite 8 allegations of sexual misconduct, still got what percentage of the vote?

S) The former president in an early meeting asked if China had a weapon that caused what?

T) The shortage of what food product is so critical that the Biden Administration will be working to alleviate the shortage?

For Republicans, the question is never, “Who is responsible?” The question is, “Who snitched?” – Middle Age Riot

Tip of the hat to http://all-hat-no-cattle.blogspot.com

Answers:

A) The air traffic controller at the Palm Beach airport

B) burying his girlfriend whom he had just killed by strangulation

C) The US House of Representatives 

D) The overturning of Roe v. Wade

E) a haboob. This is a high wind blackout sandstorm (or dirt) that usually happen in desserts

 F) Trump

G) The percentage of fake or robot accounts on the website.

H) nearly 50%  (319,000 of 641,000) 

I) Mike Pence – that should get Kemp half a dozen votes

J) Russia

K) drew a message on her sidewalk with chalk.

L) His neighbors. Apparently Alito is not liked by his neighbors

M) Finland

N) Mississippi – Tate Reeves. (Kind hearkens back to a precious era in Mississippi)

O) the black hole at the center of our galaxy, the Milky Way

P) Evansville, Indiana

Q) Red paint

R) 30% – he only lost by 3%

S) He asked over and over if China had a “hurricane gun” that could create large man-made hurricanes.

T) Baby food. If they can do what they did for covid vaccines, the shortage should be cleared up quickly.

}" data-image-title="IMG-20220515-WA0005" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://garfieldhug.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/img-20220515-wa0005.jpg?w=150" data-large-file="https://garfieldhug.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/img-20220515-wa0005.jpg?w=225" src="https://garfieldhug.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/img-20220515-wa0005.jpg" alt="" class="wp-image-52143" />

All the Gods and deities have helped me. More importantly each of your kindness to pray for me to overcome. 💞💞😃Heartfelt thanks and gratitude to one and all!

Surgery went well. My legs and nerves intact. Dr Neuro and Old Uncle did a good job of reducing surgery time from anticipated 8 hrs to 5 hrs.

I am grateful. May this 32nd surgery be my last for this lifetime. I thank my wonderful team of doctors, Drs Gastro, Dr Neuro, Dr Bones and Old Uncle.

P.s. Dr Bones just came by to pray for me and with me. He is very kind and I have full gratitude for him and his extra kindness.

Happy Vesak Day to all Buddhists and may Lord Buddha shower you all blessings and love.

title: Have shovel, still traveling.
content:
.

More trees were replaced/planted yesterday…. this time as far away from the house as is possible.

.

.

Whether theses trees will last any longer than the previous elms, oaks or apples he planted is any one’s guess.

.

title: Better Half
content:
}" data-image-title="elderly-couple" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="

Elderly couple at their home

" data-medium-file="https://lakelandmusings.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/elderly-couple.jpg?w=170" data-large-file="https://lakelandmusings.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/elderly-couple.jpg?w=170" src="https://lakelandmusings.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/elderly-couple.jpg?w=170" alt="" class="wp-image-3231" srcset="https://lakelandmusings.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/elderly-couple.jpg 170w, https://lakelandmusings.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/elderly-couple.jpg?w=150 150w" sizes="(max-width: 170px) 100vw, 170px" />

Well, where did that week go? Lately it seems as though Saturday slips up on me faster than it used to. So, what do I share with you this week?

Seeing that we are celebrating our wedding anniversary of 59 years this week, I thought it might be appropriate to share a bit of trivia with y’all relating to wedded bliss. Ever wonder where the term “Better Half” comes from?

The reality of the saying is that it is a tale from the Middle East. Yes, believe it or not, as I understand it, the origin of the modern spouse’s humility when introducing his mate as his “better half” came from a tear-jerking tale out of the Middle East.

As the story goes – a Bedouin had offended his prince and as was the way things were back then, the husband was to be put to death.

But, as luck would have it, the Bedouin’s wife truly loved him and pleaded for her spouse’s life by saying something that goes like the following:

“O great Prince, the blasphemy is horrible, I confess.

But it is not my whole husband who has thus rendered himself guilty towards Thee.”

“Not thy whole husband,” the Prince replied.

“Nay,” she continued, “it is but half, the half of him that has committed the insult; for am I not the other half, I who have never offended Thee?” Now the guilty half places itself under the protection of the innocent half and the latter cannot suffer the former to be punished.”

What are we to make of this – well, just this – it would appear that from this ancient concept of a man and woman being merged into one by marriage comes our phrase “better half.”

Don’t you feel so much smarter now.

Comical trivia:

Did you know that only Robinson Crusoe could have everything done by Friday.

Did you know that pigs are full of balony?

Seeing that I have this thing about writing – did you know that:

An editor makes a long story short.

Okay, as you can see, words aren’t coming to me like they should be so here is a quote or two before I leave you for this week:

“If you stumble, make it part of the dance.”

“In the book of life, the answers aren’t in the back.”

Charles Schulz

And if you don’t remember anything about this week’s blog, remember this:

“Life is like an ice cream. Enjoy it before it melts.”

}" data-image-title="we-all-scream-for-ice-cream-2-1552333" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://lakelandmusings.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/we-all-scream-for-ice-cream-2-1552333.jpg?w=179" data-large-file="https://lakelandmusings.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/we-all-scream-for-ice-cream-2-1552333.jpg?w=179" src="https://lakelandmusings.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/we-all-scream-for-ice-cream-2-1552333.jpg?w=179" alt="" class="wp-image-3234" width="179" height="239" srcset="https://lakelandmusings.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/we-all-scream-for-ice-cream-2-1552333.jpg 179w, https://lakelandmusings.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/we-all-scream-for-ice-cream-2-1552333.jpg?w=112 112w" sizes="(max-width: 179px) 100vw, 179px" />

Until next time! Y’all take care now, ya hear!

title: My Inherited Dog, Boomer
content:
(re-run)

Boomer was never my dog, although he came into my care when I married his owner.  I’m not sure how old he was when I met him. My dog, Tess, was two and Boomer was older.

A small, part Beagle-part terrier, Boomer had not had a regular dog’s life. He had never eaten dog food and had never been on a leash.  He was served a piece of Kentucky Fried chicken on a plate the first time I ate dinner at my fiance’s house, a house he shared with his mom.

Boomer stared up at me through the glass table top as if to say, “Who are you and what are you doing here?” Future hubby’s mother had the same look.

Tess and Boomer had fun romping through the park together, although Boomer was just a little guy, about ten pounds, and Tess was a medium sized dog at 40 pounds.

We got married in Omaha, and for our honeymoon, we drove halfway across the country with Tess in her crate in the back seat and Boomer on my lap, shooting gassy farts at me.

My husband laughed and laughed.  We were in my tiny 4-cylinder Chevy, and the January winds blowing across Kansas kept us from reaching the speed limit.

Boomer settled into his California digs and learned how to eat dog food. My husband insisted on giving him table scraps as well. Both dogs got fat.

Then the babies disrupted Boomer’s life some more. He didn’t like children much, having been teased by one as a puppy. He’d snap at the baby if she got too close. Tess, on the other hand, let kids sit on her back while she lay on the floor.

By the time we had two kids, Boomer was turning gray. We had moved into our second California house, and he was having trouble seeing and hearing me call him for dinner. My husband traveled a lot, which left me to care for his aging pet.

One night, Boomer went out the laundry room doggie door to the garage and then the side doggie door to the yard. He couldn’t find his way back, and he ended up in an open metal lunch box, barking because he couldn’t get out of it. I was freaked out, very pregnant, home alone, and too afraid to get him out of his predicament at 3:00 a.m. We’d had raccoons come into the garage through the side door. I saved him at sun-up.

There were two steps down to the garage from the laundry room door. One day I stepped out the door to the garage and tripped over carpet that had been nailed to the steps by my husband. He hadn’t bothered to tell me that he did that to help out his dog. I was furious (being very pregnant) that my husband had created a trip hazard for me. I had to explain to him what a fall might mean to the baby. I tore the carpet off the steps.

Boomer’s quality of life kept deteriorating.  I suggested that it was time to put him out of his misery. My husband disagreed. We went round and round about it until Boomer had to be carried in and out to pee.

I put my foot down.  My husband did the deed but never forgave me for it.

Ah, pets!  It is so hard to say good-bye, but until someone breeds a dog that can live as long as humans do, it is part of life, and there’s no avoiding it.

author: {site_visible=true, email=false, URL=http://kingbensgrandma.wordpress.com, site_ID=1.06549351E8, nice_name=kingbensgrandma, avatar_URL=https://1.gravatar.com/avatar/a4a14080fceec05920ffa776f6a7e018?s=96&d=monsterid&r=X, first_name=Angie, ip_address=false, login=kingbensgrandma, last_name=, name=King Ben's Grandma, ID=1.00752703E8, profile_URL=https://en.gravatar.com/kingbensgrandma}
title: #SLS ~ It’s Not Tuesday
content:
Thanks to Jim Adams, for hosting Song Lyric Sunday. In Casa Cuckoo news, I got into a minor car accident on Monday. My plastic front bumper cracked and fell mostly off, but duct tape is a wonderful thing. I wasn’t hurt. I was pulling out of a parking lot, trying to make a left turn across two lanes and a center turn lane, when BAM! I was smacking into the rear passenger wheel of an SUV. It turned into a big drama with police, fire department and the ladies left in an ambulance 🙄 The driver wanted to wait for her husband before climbing into the ambulance, but the paramedics told her if she was hurt enough to be transported, she needed to go now. Hmmm… what else? Daughter has Bronchitis again, or still🤷🏼‍♀️ It seems she’s been coughing her head off forever. I took her to Urgent Care for another inhaler and some prednisone. That was Friday. The same day Ben stayed home from school with a gut bug. Fun times at the Casa😵‍💫

The prompt words for this week are – Head, Hat, Hair, Scarf

I thought about using a Metallica song, but didn’t think it would appeal to as many listeners. So, I went with on old song sung by a guy who is really named Taco. His full name is Taco Ockerse. He was born in Jakarta to Dutch parents, and raised in Germany.

He performed old show tunes in supper clubs. Then in 1982 he released an album called After Eight with Puttin’ On The Ritz released as a single, with a video made for new channel MTV. The heavy rotation on MTV combined with the catchy song written by the great Irving Berlin, sent Taco’s song to #4 on Billboard in the US.

Songfacts had a cool bit of trivia …The success of Taco’s cover made 95-year-old Irving Berlin the oldest living songwriter ever with a single in the Top 10 of the Hot 100.

This song, though not Taco’s version, was featured in a classic comedy movie. How many of you know the movie?

If you’re blue, and you don’t know where to go to
Why don’t you go where fashion sits? Puttin’ on the ritz
Different types of wear a day coat, pants with stripes and cutaway coat
Perfect fits, puttin’ on the ritz

Dressed up like a million-dollar trooper
Trying hard to look like Gary Cooper (super-duper)
Come, let’s mix where Rockefellers walk with sticks or umbrellas in their mitts
Puttin’ on the ritz

Have you seen the well-to-do, up and down Park Avenue?
On that famous thoroughfare with their noses in the air?
High hats and arrow collars, white spats and lots of dollars
Spending every dime for a wonderful time

If you’re blue, and you don’t know where to go to
Why don’t you go where fashion sits? Puttin’ on the ritz
Different types of wear a day coat, pants with stripes and cutaway coat
Perfect fits, puttin’ on the ritz

Dressed up like a million-dollar trooper
Trying hard to look like Gary Cooper (super-duper)
Come, let’s mix where Rockefellers walk with sticks or umbrellas in their mitts
Puttin’ on the ritz

Dressed up like a million-dollar trooper
Trying hard to look like Gary Cooper (super-duper)
If you’re blue, and you don’t know where to go to
Why don’t you go where fashion sits? Puttin’ on the ritz, puttin’ on the ritz
Puttin’ on the ritz, puttin’ on the ritz

Downtown, uptown, get your kicks at the Ritz
Dine and wine, but not ’til nine, the time is right for us tonight
We gotta move, move to the rhythm
We can
Move, dance to the rhythm, nice and easy
I want ya to move
Puttin’ it on, puttin’ it on
Puttin’ it on, puttin’ it on
The R-I-T-Z
How ’bout you and me zest?

Gotta dance

Gotta dance

Gotta dance

.

What song would you choose for this prompt? There were some other obvious choices that had been recently used for other prompts by other people. I’m always looking for something offbeat or a favorite. So share your offbeat favorite cuz I love new to me music. Thanks for stopping by.

.

HUGS!!

.

.

author: {ID=1.87687429E8, last_name=Wilcenski, nice_name=spwilcen, ip_address=false, site_visible=true, URL=http://spwilcenwrites.wordpress.com, email=false, name=spwilcen, avatar_URL=https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/c8a71ab265ed577bbfb459972d0cabd9?s=96&d=identicon&r=G, site_ID=1.78602163E8, first_name=Steve, login=spwilcen, profile_URL=https://en.gravatar.com/spwilcen}
title: Old Crew Wine Episode IX – May 15, 2022
content:
}" data-image-title="Noir" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="

But not all at once, necessarily…

" data-medium-file="https://spwilcenwrites.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/noir.png?w=262" data-large-file="https://spwilcenwrites.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/noir.png?w=893" class="wp-image-6676" style="width:150px;" title="Sorry. Tommy Cigarettes got away from me. Didn't expect the man to be so, um, wordy. Regular chatterbox." src="https://spwilcenwrites.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/noir.png" alt="">
graphix: spwilcen

Episode IX
Darkside Tommy

Carrying a small duffle bag jammed with underwear, tees, socks, my shaving gear, and three pair of clean Levi’s, I pounded the button on the garage wall to open the garage door. Someone or something with a two-pack-a-day cigarette habit gravelled my name. It caught me by surprise.  Actually, put me in that precarious situation where both exhaust sphincters spasmed almost to the point of release. Probably, it being Tuesday, I had on clean tighty-whities, and laundry wasn’t until Saturday, natural urges lost out to good potty-training.

“Yeah, that’s me,” I replied out of reflex as one does when your strength is as the strength of ten because your heart is pure. Immediately reconsidering, I realized people are for the most part correct when they tell me, ‘You have shit for brains.’

Cigarettes launched into his sales pitch. “Jimmy Lewiston says I gotta bust both your kneecaps.  Capeesh?”

I could hear cigarettes but couldn’t see him.  I considered running. While I still had kneecaps.  I stalled, “Capeesh?”

“Yeah. Allus wanted to say that.  Eye-tal-yin you know, for ‘you dig?’”

“What!  Bust kneecaps? What for?” 

“Spoiled his niece’s wedding.  His favorite niece.” The most nondescript man you’d ever see stepped into the light of the open garage door.

Expecting anyone nefarious enough to smash kneecaps for a living to look at least a little sinister, I was disappointed Mister Lewiston had dispatched Tommy Nondescript to take care of business.  I also wondered if the dark web’s lackluster description of me was a good or bad thing. Tommy Disappointing giving away twenty pounds in my favor and looking like he’d hadn’t slept well in a week, I was foolishly encouraged.  “I never heard of the man. I’m thinking mistaken identity. This Lewiston guy give you anything besides a name?”

“Got a picture.” Tommy reached into his inside suitcoat pocket. 

I flinched.  An inside pocket was too small for a baseball bat but about the right size for a small caliber pistol. Kneecaps still intact, I could outrun a baseball bat but didn’t have much chance outrunning a gunshot. Then again, I supposed kneecaps could be broken by well-placed gunshots with less effort than using a 36-inch Louisville Slugger. I breathed a sigh of relief, sort of, when Tommy pulled out a photograph.

“Man, you don’t look nothing like this,” mused Tommy.  “Here.  Lookit. You know this guy?”

“That’s not me! That’s one ugly man!”

“Clearly not you. But do you know him?”

“Never seen him before.”

“Well, good thing for you.”

“You mean you aren’t gonna bust my knees anyway?”

“You think I do this for fun?”

“Well, dunno.  Never met a kneecap guy before.”

“Kneecap guy.  That’s funny.”

“Not to me.”

‘It’s a job, man. Well, that’s the breaks.  No pun there, fella.  Ah, well, shit.”

“Not ‘ah shit!’ as far as I’m concerned.”

“Understand. But look at it from my point of view.”

“How’s that?”

“I got expenses, you know?  Any idea what airfare is to this hick place?”

“From where?”

“From South… Um, let’s just say I ain’t local. Cost me a bundle.”

“Well maybe you can pick up a little odd job on the side?” Up close, Tommy smelled of garlic and Old Spice, but not of cigarettes. “Say, you don’t smoke?”

“Naw. Ain’t healthy, you know. Why?”

“Just curious.”

“Unh, yeah. Okay. About this ‘side job.’ Whaddaya mean?”

“Well there’s this woman, down at the state offices…”

“Don’t do citizen contracts.”

“Why not?”

“Pay stinks. I mean corporations and cabals can pay, you know? John Average…” Tommy shrugged. 

“Not so much, eh?”

“Right. Besides you said ‘a woman.’”

“Did. You interested?”

“No.  Woman. Too dangerous.”

“Oh, I see.  A sissy huh?”

“Nothing sissy about it. Gotta be more careful.  Women are pack animals. Hard to isolate, see?”

“Yeah, guess so.”

“So I’d rather not, all the same to you.”

“Too bad.”

“Love to stay and chat but I gotta check with Mister Lewiston.  See what he wants I should do next.”

“Sorry to disappoint.”

“At’s okay. Have a nice day.”

—

title: Subverting Expectations
content:
Tonight events happened that occupied time

And now I must sleep and dream of a mime.

I probably won’t, but it goes to show

I don’t always rhyme “time” with “rhyme”, my bro.

title: You say potato
content:
}" data-image-title="potato-head" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://mikerichardsdotblog.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/potato-head.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://mikerichardsdotblog.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/potato-head.jpg?w=400" src="https://mikerichardsdotblog.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/potato-head.jpg?w=400" alt="" class="wp-image-2518" width="243" height="182" srcset="https://mikerichardsdotblog.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/potato-head.jpg?w=243 243w, https://mikerichardsdotblog.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/potato-head.jpg?w=150 150w, https://mikerichardsdotblog.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/potato-head.jpg?w=300 300w, https://mikerichardsdotblog.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/potato-head.jpg 400w" sizes="(max-width: 243px) 100vw, 243px" />

Mr. Potato Head has just turned 70.

I would have hours of endless vegetable-related fun in my Balham flat as a kid. Although potatoes became quite dangerous if the plastic hat and moustache were still impaled while being roasted.

But, 70-years ago, were Mr. and Mrs. Potato (Senior) sitting down with their son asking whether he was going to be a chip; crisp or dauphinoise, only to be disappointed to hear he wanted to be a model?

Also, in 1585, when Sir Walter Raleigh first brought potatoes to the UK, did he think their prime aim would be for children’s entertainment? Perhaps, when looking for El Dorado (the mythical South American city, not the BBC show), he saw someone with a head shaped like a potato with stumpy legs, sporting a small hat and moustache one would normally associate with risqué films in the 60s?

Growing up, when you had the introduction of ‘celebrity’ chefs, you’d never see Fanny Craddock sticking some comedy ears on a potato she was about to show us how to cook.  Perhaps, Johnny did this behind her back?  If so, you’d have thought it would have had a monocle like his?

author: {ip_address=false, name=Andrew’s World of Writing, first_name=Andrew, URL=http://adcamper92.wordpress.com, avatar_URL=https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/ea7b69d4d0b55ed7d18e6c088860dd92?s=96&d=identicon&r=G, login=adcampbell92, site_ID=2.01479666E8, last_name=Campbell, email=false, profile_URL=https://en.gravatar.com/adcampbell92, site_visible=true, ID=2.15729494E8, nice_name=adcampbell92}
title: My Multiverse of May-hem. (5.14.22)
content:
So we haven’t been writing much lately. That’s been due to the busy schedule, but here’s a thought we’ve had after watching a movie.

Theoretically, there an infinite number of universes where for every thought, every scenario is happening simultaneously right now as we type this out. After watching a recent movie, a box office hit if I might add, every dream we’ve had there’s a reality in which it’s happened. (Yes even the one where we show up to class with no pants, that’s a really common one am I right?)

I can’t help but wonder how the other life lives, as somewhere out in the universe, there’s a version of me dreaming about me or somehow wanting a version of my existence. Then again I’m convinced we’re all living in a simulation much like SIMS, where the Almighty himself is actually just a guy at a computer controlling our actions. Ever have that feeling where you walk in a room and suddenly forget why you were there in the first place? Boom. Sims game, bet you didn’t think that was the reason, huh?

But no, if the multiverse is a real thing, when can I dimension jump to the version who’s a millionaire? In other news, I’ve realized life is full of twists and turns, and they’re usually better executed than a novel written by a crudely published author, but sometimes we just have to ride them out these series of unfortunate events. I really don’t have much to comment on aside from the day to day musings. I’m making changes little at a time and putting out there that things will get better. I’m manifesting the things I want instead of acting passively. I’m taking charge of the chaos and owning it. I’m not mind controlling an entire town and bending them to my every will, because that’s NOT possible. Life’s too short to worry about the little nuisances, instead look at the bigger picture and go forth into the world and be the keeper of your destiny. I’m ready for a vacation and I plan to use it for charging and making use of my free time.

Until Next Time,

Drew

author: {name=Lucien, site_ID=6134631.0, avatar_URL=https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/8e18cd8d5c3381e8739de5adea9c9ac6?s=96&d=identicon&r=G, login=lucien0maverick, nice_name=lucien0maverick, first_name=Lucien, ip_address=false, email=false, URL=, profile_URL=https://en.gravatar.com/lucien0maverick, last_name=Maverick, site_visible=true, ID=6380886.0}
title: Tales From the Library: Summer Boobs and Mail-Order Brides
content:
I used to work for my university library at my old alma mater. It was a simple job that I became one of the MVPs of, who trained all the new people because the girl who did the training left after she was done with college. It was a pretty decent gig for a college student, where I could work part time and have some spending money when I was living in the dorms and needed some extra cash for gas or whatever. I met one of my current best friends there, had a friendship with someone go sour because of their jealous husband, and shocking everyone who worked there that a titan of my size could somehow disappear in that place. I got a few stories, and I felt like sharing two of them with you.

The first is about a girl and a guy coming into the place in summer.  Here’s something to know about the Library in the summer – it gets hot.  There are HUGE windows that have direct sunlight coming into them all day, so it gets pretty hot, pretty quick.  One of the perks of this, for a young man in college, is that a lot of women end up taking off layers in that joint.  Now don’t worry, I wasn’t overtly ogling them.  I may be something of a libertine, but I’m at least classy about it.  However, when you are able to enjoy the view, you do so in the discreet manner of which you become VERY accustomed to.  And MAN, being a titan who stands just under 7ft tall comes in handy at no time better than this.  Neat fact – a gay girly-mate came to the Library sometimes to chill with me, and she could overtly ogle and no woman ever said a word.  In fact, one chick was flattered.  Gay women really can get away with anything.  A fact that she never stopped finding funny.

Anyway, we have these study rooms that students can rent for a set time period.  We unlock them, they have their full time period, and then they leave.  It automatically locks when they go, so we don’t have to do anything.  One day, a guy and a girl show up in the height of summer.  These rooms have a full view, so if you’re thinking people can use them to fuck, you’re sadly mistaken.  But it was clear right off the bat that this guy and this girl had VERY different ideas about why they were here, and I’m about to shock you – the genders you’re thinking it is are wrong.

This guy looked like such a dork, and was he ALL about the studying.  He was keeping on task so well.  I know this because I was shelving in the section across from the study room, and occasionally I would see what was going on in there.  This guy was all about the books, but this girl was somewhere COMPLETELY different.  You ever seen a chick throw herself at a guy so much that there are pretty much landing lights to her snatch?  Yeah, that was this.  I’ve never seen a woman be more overtly sexual in my entire life.  She was throwing herself at this guy so hard.  What made this interesting is that the dork guy didn’t seem to notice this, at ALL.  As the afternoon went on, and I kept finding reasons to stay in this section because this was getting fun to watch, it became clear that she was getting very, very frustrated with this guy’s lack of awareness of what she is trying to do.  I half expected her to hit him and yell at him and ask what his deal is, that’s how ugly the expression on her face got.

The day ends with the two of them leaving, and I could see this chick looked PISSED.  As fate would have it, I was at the front desk when they came back and told the desk staff that they were done with the room.  And I swear, I thought I heard this chick whisper to herself, “I wasted my entire fucking day…”  I have no idea what she sees in that dork, but I guess he is the most clueless man in existence.

Another story worth telling is the fact that we had computers at the Library.  People would come in to print papers, research stuff, or just use the Internet for whatever.  By and large, it was pretty chill.  The computers were all plainly visible to anyone, so I’ve never had anyone stupid enough to look up porn there.  However, one day, I had a neat little interaction with a guy who decided that he was going to look for love on the Library computers.  Not the dating app kind of love, but the “she has no choice but to be with me” kind.  That’s right, this dude was actually looking up Russian mail-order brides on the Library computers. 

Now, I’m not entirely sure what to do in this situation.  On the one hand, it isn’t porn.  There’s nothing explicit on this site.  All the women being shown are fully clothed.  But this is clearly awkward and I could tell was making at least one person who was at a computer nearby uncomfortable.  Maybe it was the noises this guy was making when he was looking at the various women who were on offer from this I’m sure totally legit service.  I go to the front desk and ask what the protocol is, and they’re just as amused as I am.  The gal there tells me to talk to the guy, but do it quietly and not make a big deal out of it.  Which means, in other words, that I’m basically stuck trying to find a way to get this guy out of here without making a scene.

Anyone who knows me knows that I am a consummate smart-ass, so I decide that I’m going to take the very direct approach with this.  I walk over, grab a chair from a desk that isn’t occupied, and park it right next to this guy.  He smelled weird.  I can’t describe the smell.  It’s like some kind of mix between fish and gasoline.  No wonder he’s looking for a mail-order bride.  Dude doesn’t even notice.  He’s 100% focused on these Russian women that he is looking to purchase for his…needs.  I get right next to the guy and very quietly go, “oh man, that one looks good!  What do you think?”  Needless to say, the guy looks up in shock and starts making excuses that he just ended up there.  I was told not to make a scene, so I decide to keep to that criteria.  Leaning in real close, I go, “look, buddy, I don’t care where you decide to look for love of the illegal kind, but if you could not do it here, that would be great.” 

The stinky man got right up and decided to shuffle away very quickly, face beet red, clearly awkward about the whole interaction and left.  I put the chair back at the desk, logged the computer out, and then had a gal who was nearby him and uncomfortable thank me.  It was a strange but good day at the Library.

I have a few more of these stories, and I think I’ll save those for another post.

Until next time, a quote,

“Where the fuck do you keep disappearing to?  You’re huge!  How do you hide out there?!” – Coworker

Peace out,

Maverick
excerpt: I used to work for my university library at my old alma mater. It was a simple job that I became one of the MVPs of, who trained all the new people because the girl who did the training left after she was done with college. It was a pretty decent gig for a college […]

title: The DnD Adventure(ish)
content:
There sat, around a campfire, four brave souls spending the last night they had left before an epic adventure was to unfold.
The first was a thief. Small in nature and twitchy like a rat, he smiled to himself as he gazed upon the flames. They were gold like the thoughts swimming in his head. Mere hours from now, he just knew it, his hands would have coins and jewels dripping from the fingertips. Oh the things he would do with it! He pawed at the air absently as if to scoop in the invisible treasure and will it into reality.

Next to him, a little further away, sat a wizard. He looked, almost, as most wizards would with his long grey robes and matching beard. He had an unlit pipe hanging from his lips precariously as a large belch needed the extra room to escape. Unlike most other wizards, as could now be made apparent, this one was….incredibly gross. He scratched at his beard and the warrior we haven’t met yet was almost sure he saw fleas skittering around the matts. Everyone sat away from him to avoid said fleas (and smell) and tried to play it off as a respectful sort of fear of his power. After all, dirty or not, he could still turn them all into toads if he so pleased. 
“I heard he doesn’t bathe on purpose” someone (who is now no longer with the party) had whispered once. “Believes it will taint the magic somehow. But I think he really just wants an excuse not to bother with it.” The speaker had been a goblin. A good goblin, really, for as long as he had been around. Such a shame to have lost him so soon.

Across from the thief sat the noble warrior. His armor (or at least the parts that hadn’t rusted over) were engraved with the design of his familys’ crest. And around his shoulders, he wrapped himself in the remnants of a faded purple banner. The very one he had once raised high in the air on a staff of fine mahogany. A marker for all to see the glory of his family and name….
But that was a long time ago. Back before the fall of his kingdom. If the thief dreamed of gold, the warrior dreamed of glory. Somewhere, at the end of their venture, there was rumored to be a creature of such power, that anything one imagined could be made real. And there was nothing the weathered warrior imagined more often than a way to take back the shame he felt when he failed to vanquish the dragon that brought ruin (and yet more shame) to his kingdom and family name. (In case you missed it, he’s kinda fixated on this family name thing.)
The warrior heaved a heavy sigh and then immediately looked aghast, as the wizard had stood up to relieve himself in plain view for all to see. Where once there was a new moon, now it was apparently full. What magic he had indeed.
There was an awkward cough and all parties tried as hard as they could to find a place, any place, to look away from the aging man urinating next to them.

Lastly, in his own corner, sat our last member. Unlike others, he wasn’t gazing at the fire or some imagined outcome. But rather, he sat lovingly polishing the wood of his lute. For our last member, as you guessed it, was none other than the games’ token Bard. He wasn’t originally a part of the crew. There seemed to be rules of there being only 4 allowed (and there had been 4, at one point he was told) but while at a tavern, as he sat getting deeper into his drinks, a vacancy had apparently “magically” appeared. And, as he was drunk and aimed to be moreso, and they seemed to have the coin for it, he found himself stumbling into their….fine, company. It wasn’t until much later that he was sober enough to realize the mistake he had made. Regardless, he was a collector of stories and writer of tales so he decided to stay and see how this one unfolded. As to whether it would be an epic song or yet another sad comedy, he had yet to decide.

Now that introductions have been properly made, we’ll fast forward a bit so we don’t get bored. The fire had long since turned to embers and the “moon” was off in his corner snoring loudly. And off in the distance, the sky was growing lighter as the sun decided the day was ready to begin.
And begin it did. With groans aplenty. The team stirred and woke up. The grinding from the warriors armor was the only thing to be improved by the sheet of moisture the dew left behind.
“You know, the stories always describe mornings like this as being beautiful and all but I just feel….soggy.” said one
“Yeah well, whoever said that hasn’t had to camp with nothing but a bed roll to use for shelter” said another
And the wizard just grunted and the fire was returned to its blazing glory.
The Bard wondered, again, if it was too late in the game to go home.

Fast forward a little more, our troupe stood stoicly at the entrance of a large cave. Signs hung, here and there, warning all travelers to beware.
The thief, as he had high stealth stats, went in first.
The tunnel leading inward was dark and narrow. The ceiling dripped here and there and the sounds echoed on and on. Still, the thief knew what he was doing. Working in the dark was how he worked best, and he continued to the back of the cavern to where he knew his treasure would lie.
And just as he had wished: there it was. It glowed, as if on its own accord, sending golden hues dancing onto the walls nearby. If a holy choir of angels could be heard singing, our thief was ready and willing to sing along. Because there is was! The treasure! And he was the first to find it, completely alone, with no one around to be a witness. The thief let out an excited squeak and jumped for joy before running to claim his prize.

From outside the cave, it wasnt an excited squeak but a wild scream that could be heard echoing from inside. The agonizing sound carried long and far to the ears of the rest of the crew. The wizard let out a humph in response and the warrior, ready to return glory to his name (as always), unsheathed his screeching sword and went running in after him. The wizard followed next lighting the path with his staff. The Bard, excited by the change of events in spite of himself, followed at the rear, playing tunes on his lute to add to the suspense.

The scene found at the end of the cavern was unlike what any, one person, could have imagined. From an old chest of dirty clothes in the back, wafted up a genie like creature. Only it wasn’t a genie, it was a 2-headed dragon enraged at being disturbed.
The warrior yowled with fury at the sight of it.
“it lives! It lives still! The dragon from my kingdom!” and the dragon rawred and filled the ceiling with bristling flame.
“You fools! You’ll kill us all!” shouted the wizard, his voice could be heard from above the chaos of noise and shouts. “It becomes whatever you imagine! Whatever you think and it will be so!” and in response, for a split second, the creature’s flesh boiled and rippled as it changed shape to take on a new, more deadly, form.
“Think of something else! Anything else!”
Suddenly the rippling stopped and the dragons’ fire was sucked back in. The creature started to grow in size like a balloon being inflated. The color leeched and the dragon’s many horns grew thin and sparse until the shape was completely changed.
The Bard’s eyes grew wide in horror as realization set in, his lute hanging idly at his side.
The new monster, in the shape of a gaint old wizards sagging butt now came bouncing towards them.

More deadly indeed.

Hanson, avatar_URL=https://0.gravatar.com/avatar/30517110ff67d6eb9fbbbb485f6f55b5?s=96&d=identicon&r=G, site_ID=2.00607864E8, last_name=Hanson, ID=1.84968482E8, ip_address=false, nice_name=kjhanson2, site_visible=true, login=kjhanson2, first_name=Kane}
title: A Writer’s Mind
content:
There’s a soft knock on the door. The door creaks open. It’s time for my wife to go to work.

She kisses me on the cheek, “Bye, honey,” she says, “I’ll see you tonight.” I put my arm around her waist and pull her closer, press my lips to hers for a brief second and break away with an intentional smacking sound. “Love you,” I say.

“Love you, too” She says as I turn back to my work. Then after a moment she adds, “What are you working on?”

I notice she has glanced at my computer screen. A betrayal! I quickly click to a different tab on my screen. My jaw clenches in an effort to restrain my tongue. What am I working on? Who is she to ask what I’m working on? How am I supposed to know? Now, I guess I have to stop—in the middle of what I’m working on—and answer these asinine questions. I swear this is intolerable. Finally I calmed down enough to speak. “I’m writing,” I mutter through slightly parted teeth.

“Oh, neat! What about?” She asks it with a bubbly ring in her voice. 

This is ridiculous. I will not be interrogated in my own house! I need something non-committal. I can’t tell her what I’m really writing about, because I’m not even sure. And she’ll think I don’t know what I’m doing if I say that. Okay, got it. “I’m just working on some different stories. You know… the usual.” Nice. That should satisfy her sadistic quest to pump information out of me.

“I’d like to read it,” she says, “I’m sure it’s wonderful with how much you’ve been working on it.”

My teeth clench so hard I feel my heartbeat in my jaw. I exhale quickly and angrily through my nose. Can I afford a divorce? Psh, trying to read something that is a work in progress? I can’t believe her. That should be a crime! “You should really head to work.” I don’t even look up.
She stands still for a moment, palpably angry. She then leaves and shuts the door without another word. How am I supposed to write now? I’m fuming! I wait for the garage door to close, and then go back to bed for my morning nap.

title: Jen Psaki Steps Down As White House Press Secretary To Take Position As The Mouth Of Sauron
content:
From The Babylon Bee:

MORDOR—Jen Psaki has announced that she is stepping down as White House Press Secretary in order to take up a position as the Mouth of Sauron. In her new role, she will be recognized as one of Sauron’s most devoted followers—serving as his trusted herald and messenger, spinning all of Sauron’s lies into a narrative, deflecting legitimate questions, and of course, circling back later.

“The White House was just a stepping stone for where I wanted to go in my career. I think my work speaks for itself, which is why I was selected personally to serve the Dark Lord himself,” announced Jen Psaki from the Dark Tower. “I will be one of the few servants of Mordor able to communicate directly with Sauron. Yippee!”

“Obfuscating the truth comes naturally for her,” said Gothmang Kurbag, lieutenant of Mordor’s 9th battalion. “It’s not every age of Middle Earth we see someone this talented at spreading disinformation and silencing those who would speak the truth.”

According to sources, Jen Psaki settled into her new role quickly. She was already masterfully pinning the woes of Middle Earth onto the Gondorian Nationalists when confronted at the Black Gate. “My master, Sauron the Great, bids thee welcome. Is there any in this rout with authority to treat with me? Or indeed with wit to understand me?” she said, flashing a brief cruel smile. “Indeed, inflation, soaring oats prices, war, and sickness throughout the land are a direct result of the Dark Lord’s predecessor and his ilk.”

At publishing time, the Mouth of Sauron dismissed Trump’s claims of being the Great MAGA King. She tossed a discarded buffalo hat onto the ground as a token signifying their failure. “Aha, I was bidden to show thee,” she said. “I want you to know he suffered greatly, Donald.”

title: Poems About Monsters
content:
This blog has several poems,
Some about dogs and cats,
Some about possums and sharks,
But you might notice that,

There are so many about monsters,
Horrible beasts that scare,
And that’s because there’s so many,
Monsters lurking out there.

title: Big Baseball Bullies More Streaming Services
content:
Major League Baseball is strong-arming additional streaming platforms into showing baseball games. And the 23 people in America who watch baseball are not having it.

NBC had originally drawn the short straw from among the TV Networks, but luckily they were able to shuffle Sunday Morning Baseball onto their Peacock streaming service. Whew! Folks have college football to watch.

Now Big Baseball has announced games streaming on Apple TV and Amazon Prime! Whoa. We gotta crunch the numbers on this one. If you want to catch all the hottest baseball games, you better cancel Netflix and your trash and water service because it’s going to add up!

}" data-image-title="MLB Streaming Platforms" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://athleteinspace.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/mlb-streaming-platforms.png?w=400" data-large-file="https://athleteinspace.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/mlb-streaming-platforms.png?w=400" src="https://athleteinspace.files.wordpress.com/2022/05/mlb-streaming-platforms.png" alt="" class="wp-image-3635" />

Good luck keeping your viewers, MLB!

title: Cute little Bailey
content:
I enjoy playing with my favorite family! Bailey has indeed a fiery, sassy personality. I’m completely smitten with her! After lunch, I decided to photograph her as she fell asleep in her highchair.

author: {login=avikasdethe, first_name=Vikas, site_visible=true, last_name=Dethe, site_ID=2.06935205E8, ip_address=false, nice_name=avikasdethe, ID=2.20955098E8, profile_URL=https://en.gravatar.com/avikasdethe, name=Aryan, email=false, URL=http://aryanthefictionstorywriter.wordpress.com, avatar_URL=https://2.gravatar.com/avatar/2ef7e2a58000857e19310ec0aeba1a5b?s=96&d=identicon&r=G}
title: मी प्रेम केलंय तुझ्यावर…..
content:
आयुष्यात माणसाला एकदा तरी प्रेम होतं.मग त्यात काही जण आपलं प्रेम व्यक्त करतात तर काही जण लपवता. इथे माणसाला दोन प्रकारचे प्रेम होतं त्यातं पहिलं प्रेम हे सुंदर दिसण्यावर आणि दुसरं प्रेम हे त्या व्यक्तीच्या स्वभावावर, वागण्यावर होतं. प्रेम कधी होईल, कसं होईल सांगता येत नाही फक्त प्रेम होईल. मी अशा व्यक्तीवर प्रेम केलंय की मी ते तिला सांगू शकलो नाही. कारणं की मला माहित नाही तीला माझ्या मनातील भावना कळल्या नाहीत पण मी त्या व्यक्तीवर केलेलं प्रेम या कवितेत व्यक्त करण्याचा प्रयत्न केला. हि कविता लिहिली तिच्या आठवणीत…

आत्ता जरी आपली भेट होतं नाही पण तुझी आठवण मात्र कायम स्वरुपी माझ्या सोबत आहे
मी जरी माझं प्रेम तुला सांगु शकलो नाही पण मी ते हे शब्दात उतरवण्यचा प्रयत्न करतो आणि माझं प्रेम हे शब्दात व्यक्त होईल एवढ कमी पण नाही. “एखाद्यी व्यक्ती आपल्याला आवडणे हे आपल्या हातात असते पण त्या व्यक्तीने आपल्याला पसंत करणे हे आपल्या हातात नसते”
हे बघ _______ तुला माझं प्रेम कळतंय का नाही हे मला माहित नाही पण माझा असा एक पण दिवस नाही की तुझी आठवण येतं नाही’ मला वाटते तु पुन्हा भेटावसं वाटतं तुझ्या सोबत बोलावं पण तुला माझं प्रेम नाही समजायचं कारण…..

मी प्रेम केलंय तुझ्यावर
ना की तुझ्या दिसण्यावर

पहिल्यांदा तुला पाहिल्यावर
भारावलो तुझ्या सुंदरतेवर
पण मला प्रेम झालं तुझ्या स्वभावावर
तुझ्या त्या वागण्यावर …..

मी प्रेम केलंय तुझ्यावर
तुझ्या त्या हसण्यावर, त्या रूसण्यावर
मन खुश होते तु दिसल्यावर
कधी उदास होते तु नसल्यावर…..

मी प्रेम केलंय तुझ्यावर
म्हणून जगतोय तुझ्या आठवणी वर
जसं मी प्रेम केलंय तुझ्यावर
तु सांगना मला तु प्रेम केलंय का माझ्यावर…..
– आर्यन (वि.व.दे)

title: घर
content:
जशी आपणं आपल्या कार्याची सुरुवात मंदिरातुन करतो तशी आपल्या जीवनाची सुरुवात घरातूनच होते.घर एक मंदिर आहे आणि या मंदिराचे देव आपले आई-वडील,हे जग त्यांनी दाखवले.तर या घराचे आधारस्तंभ हेच. घर हे आपल्या आयुष्यातील पहिला शाळा असते. घर म्हणजे काय असतं तर ते आज्जी आजोबांचा आशिर्वाद असतो, आई-वडीलांचे कष्ट असतात आणि भावा बहिणींच्या नात्यातल्या गोडवा असतो. आपल्या घराची खरी ओळख हि आपल्या संस्कार आणि संस्कृती वरुन ठरवली जाते. जिथे चांगले संस्कार असतात तिथे असते चांगले कुटुंब तेच असते एक चांगले घर.
घर म्हणजे फक्त नुसत्या चार भिंती नसतात तर घर एक सुंदर स्वप्न असतं जगण्यासाठी विणलेलं घरटं असतं. तिथे आपल्या आयुष्यातील आठवणींचा खजिना असतो.घर कसं काय असेना ती झोपडी असो या बंगला, ती एक प्रत्येकाची हक्काची जागा असते, आरामाची जागा असते आणि त्या जागेला आपल्याला पद्धतीने सजवण्याचा प्रयत्न करत असतो. घरात आपल्या त्यातच आपली वेगळी दुनिया उभारण्याचा प्रयत्न करत असतो.त्यात आपल्या गरजांच्या वस्तू, आवडीच्या वस्तूंनी घर सजवत असतो. माणुस दिवसभर कुठे गेला,कामाने वैतागलेला का असेना पण तो आपल्या घरी गेल्यावर आपल्या माणसांत बसल्यावर,बोल्यावर त्याचं मन प्रसन्न होऊन जातो. घर म्हणजे असते एक विणलेेल्या धाग्यसारखं नातं जसा धागा निसटला तर सगळं विस्कटतं तसेच नात्यात पण सारखं आहे म्हणून माणसाने प्रत्येकाची मन जपणं पण गरजेचे आहे.
घरासाठी महत्वाचे दोन पैलू असतात आई आणि वडील. हे घरासाठी, घरातल्या व्यक्ती च्या सुखा दुःखासाठी दिवस रात्र मेहनत करतात. घरातल्या व्यक्तींच्या आवडीनिवडी यांना माहिती असतात. सगळ्यांना आनंदी ठेवण्यासाठी प्रयत्न करत असतात.
घराला हवी असतातं घराला घरपण देणारी माणसं,आपली हक्काची माणसं.जिथे आहे आपुलकी माया, प्रेम तिथे असतं घर. तिथे आपल्या सुखा दुःखात सहभागी असतात आपली माणसं संकटात खंबीरपणे उभे असतात आपली हक्काची माणसं आणि आपल्याच माणसांमुळे टिकते आपल्या घराचे घरपण.
असं नाही की सगळे दिवस सारखे असतात संकट आल्यावर जे एकमेकांना समजून घेतात,त्यातून मार्ग शोधतात, प्रसंग आल्यावर एकत्र येऊन त्याबरोबर लढतात ते असतं घर.
घरची जबाबदारी कधी आणि कोणावर येईल सांगता येणार नाही पण घराची जबाबदारी एक ना एक दिवस सगळ्यावर येते. प्रत्येक जण घरासाठी, घरच्यांसाठी, त्यांच्या सुखासाठी, आनंदासाठी प्रयत्न करत असतो. या जबाबदारीतून पार पडत असतांना आपल्या वडिलांची आठवण पावलापावलावर होत असते. तेव्हा त्यांच्या कार्याची आठवण होते कि सगळ्यांच्या सुखासाठी आपल्या इच्छा आकांक्षा बाजूला ठेवून त्यांच्यासाठी काम करावं लागतं. ते म्हणतात ना की देवळात गेल्याशिवाय देव दिसत नाही तसं बापाची जागा घेतल्या शिवाय बापाचं बापपणं कळत नाही
आपल्या संपूर्ण आयुष्याचा जिवन प्रवास हा आपल्या घरात होतो. आपलं बोलणं, चालणं, धावणं,पळतं, आपलं दुःख आनंद हे सगळं घराला माहिती असतं. आपल्या जन्मापासून ते मृत्यूपर्यंत प्रवास हा आपल्या घरातल्या प्रत्येक भिंतीत, वस्तू आठवणी दडलेल्या असतात. एखाद्यी व्यक्ती आपल्यात नसली तरी त्या व्यक्तीची आठवण करून देतं ते घर.
excerpt: जशी आपणं आपल्या कार्याची सुरुवात मंदिरातुन करतो तशी आपल्या जीवनाची सुरुवात घरातूनच होते.घर एक मंदिर आहे आणि या मंदिराचे देव आपले आई-वडील,हे जग त्यांनी दाखवले.तर या घराचे आधारस्तंभ हेच. घर हे आपल्या आयुष्यातील पहिला शाळा असते. घर म्हणजे काय असतं तर ते आज्जी आजोबांचा आशिर्वाद असतो, आई-वडीलांचे कष्ट असतात आणि भावा बहिणींच्या नात्यातल्या गोडवा असतो. […]

title: May 15, 2022 Easter V
content:
While driving around this past week, I passed a local high school with a huge first responder presence. At first I feared a major tragedy, but on closer inspection I realized this school was participating in a “Shattered Dreams” enactment. The program involves graphic presentations of how poor choices involving drugs, alcohol, or texting while driving can result in often tragic and permanent consequences. It is a call to parents and students to “get your house in order.” Everyone watching knows that the events depicted are fictional, but the impact and associated emotions are quite real.

I suddenly was reminded of many such programs from my past in education, and especially the one that included Cameron as one of the “victims.” The parents of these “victims” were requested to write a letter to their child, an offering of what they would have wanted say before such a tragedy. It was the most difficult thing that I have ever written. Some parents agreed to read their letters to the whole assembly of students. Barely able to contain my emotions while writing the letter, I declined the opportunity to read it aloud.

I drove on home remembering a field of simple white crosses outside the event that year with Cameron. I had pulled up the one with her name on it and placed it our backyard garden. Over the next ten years her name had faded and the wood had degraded to compost. But as I entered the yard, I could see it in my mind as clearly as it appeared with the others at Keller High School that spring day. Happening upon that emotion charged event this week was a reminder that my words and actions of caring should not be withheld for a future time. Loving each other is not to be delayed. Love requires our words and our actions now, especially now, as Cameron and Hunter become parents themselves this summer.

The prophet Isaiah went to King Hezekiah and said to him, “Thus says the Lord: Set your house in order, for you shall die; you shall not recover.” Today “putting your affairs in order” is generally a call to make necessary financial arrangements because the time to accomplish such work is limited. How much long-term financial order one can achieve under an emotion charged time constraint is questionable, although I suppose that it is doable. Regardless of our financial condition, the order and balance of our being requires daily attention to the details. All our assets will be distributed, whether by our plan or another’s, but how our life is distributed is totally in our hands.

At the last supper, Jesus knew his time with the disciples was very short. He was like a dying man, saying what was most important to him. While Judas had walked away from the twelve, the Messiah knew all of them were sinners, weak, and fallible. Jesus knew that neither the disciples, nor any of us could reach the kingdom of heaven simply following the law and commandments. Jesus also knew that his love for them was greater than their shortcomings. Therefore, Jesus then gave a final charge, which is most difficult for the weak, the sinner, or the selfish. His word did not require a stone tablet, nor an ark to hold it. Jesus and the Spirit had given the disciples, and given us, the knowledge and power to continue his works. However, his new commandment requires a personal commitment to be recognized as a follower of Jesus. “Loving others as He loves us” is a commitment that cannot be delayed until some comfortable, later, time.

Pax,

jbt

title: Under the Banner of…oh my heck, Ep. 4 spoilers
content:
Guest post by CJ Obray

15 May 2022

This post is for those UTBOH watchers who are frustrated by departures from historical accuracy and also frustrated that Brenda Lafferty’s voice seems to be getting lost from the narrative.

Yes, and yes. I see you. I hear you. I don’t disagree with you. Brenda’s voice certainly and absolutely deserves to be heard. She was literally and brutally silenced by people who saw her as a threat to their power and purpose. She was the target of very specific animas because she had the audacity to think, speak, and behave as a sentient individual in a community that did not value her for anything other than her ability to reproduce and to bow and scrape in obeisance.

This is precisely the point. Brenda’s voice was harshly removed from the narrative, not just from the narrative of this story, but from the larger narrative of our collective lives. We miss her. We miss her shining confidence, her kindness, her gentleness, her intelligence, her influence for good. What have we lost because she is gone? We can only guess. What we are left with is a world, and a story, that is darker and bleaker without her in it.

Allegorically, Brenda’s character in the story can be seen as a representation of what the world loses because of the marginalization, the oppression, the silencing of women by men who believe the God-given role of women is to serve the men around them. Horrific murder is certainly the most emphatic way of keeping women from stepping out of “their place,” but it’s not the only way. If you’ve noticed the plot progression that has virtually all of the female characters in the story gradually being told to defer to male authority, hush up, or worse, please remember that this is authentic for the time and place in which the story is set. You may quibble over whether the hair or clothing styles are right for 1984 in Utah County, or whether the regional pronunciations or idioms are on-point, but the larger vibe in the story is bang-on: very real social and theological forces at work in the Lafferty family and in the community caught Brenda in a vortex from which she was ill-equipped to escape.

There’s your historical accuracy.

In this story – the story of how the Lafferty brothers went from being fairly normal mainstream Mormon brethren to frighteningly free-lance fundamentalists – Brenda’s story is, unfortunately, a painful and all-too-brief moment in the timeline. For the Lafferty brothers, the story was always and only about them and how they were going to ascend to glory. They weren’t concerned about anything or anyone else, as is evidenced by how they treated their own wives, sisters, daughters, and mother. Anyone who didn’t go along to get along was in as much peril as Brenda was, and – although they all were aware of how terrible their existence could become if they didn’t fall into line – they were probably all hoping their concerns were unfounded, and likely didn’t dare voice them out loud, not even to each other, for fear of retaliation.

How do you convey that fear visually? Through scenes showing Grandma Lafferty explaining to Matilda what her duty is and that she must always prop up her husband without him knowing she’s doing it, through Dan and his brothers ordering Brenda to shut up and stop asking questions so she doesn’t look like an “idiot,” through Matilda cowering in the passenger seat as Dan speeds recklessly down the highway while he’s shouting at her, and Ron forcibly shoving Dianna into their vehicle after he finds out she’s been writing letters to church leaders without his knowledge. Even in the kinder, gentler environment of the Pyre household, Jeb finds ways to remind Becca that whenever there’s a conflict, she’s supposed to put her ideas and feelings aside in favor of his priesthood authority, whether he’s right or not. The net effect of these more minor moments of domineering behavior is that all of these men are left to do pretty much as they please, and no one stands up to them when they’re out of line because – well – they have the priesthood.

Have you noticed that as the story moves along, as it gets darker and more intense, the women are starting to fade into the background? Why is this happening? Yes, the murders of Brenda and Erica Lafferty serve as the catalyst for the story, but not as is focal point. I sincerely hope that someone will soon write a book and/or create a show that focuses on Brenda’s life rather than on her death. But that is not what’s happening in Banner, and it’s not what was happening in the book that inspired the TV series, either. The TV series is focused on examining the theological and cultural history of the emphatically patriarchal Mormon church over time, and the ways that historical legacy created a violence-tolerant cultural environment in Utah County in 1984 (and, by extension, the church as it exists today). From the outset, it is clear that women will play supporting roles in the show – the story line centers on the spiritual epiphany and accelerated deconstruction of a “typical” mainstream Mormon male. Viewers who tune in hoping to see a story that centers on Brenda Lafferty are likely to be frustrated that her voice, her presence, in this story is marginalized. From a storytelling perspective, though, that’s the entire point.

Brenda came from a forward-thinking family: her parents were both well-educated and working in professional careers. Brenda had been raised to be self-directing and aspirational, at least to the extent she could make that work within the framework of her family’s LDS belief system:  regardless of whatever personal goals or desires she may have had, her faith still required her to marry within the church and adhere to its doctrinal demands if she wanted to secure her own salvation. Still, although she was accustomed to a family dynamic in which she was important, in which her thoughts and feelings were important, she was also raised in a church community where deference to male authority was not just typical but expected. She went to BYU to get away from the “party atmosphere” of the local colleges in Idaho. She was enamored not just with Allen Lafferty, but also with his “Mormon royalty” family – they fit the familiar Mormon mold with which she was so familiar. Her parents had created an environment in which Brenda could thrive, so it was not unreasonable for her to expect the same from the family she married into, because they also were faithful members of the LDS church.

That’s where the disconnect occurred: Brenda expected the Lafferty family dynamic to be similar to her own. Meanwhile, the Laffertys expected Brenda to conform to their family dynamic, regardless of her own expectations. By the time she realized those expectations didn’t line up, she was already in too deep. When she raised her voice and stated her objections, expecting to be respected as she had been in her own family, she was met with derision and hostility. Is what we see on-screen perhaps more pronounced than what occurs in many Mormon families? Maybe. Maybe not. How often do Mormon men pull their priesthood rank in their families without a second thought? Jeb Pyre – the “good” guy in this story – uses it to get what he wants, and the Lafferty brothers do the same, only more aggressively. They use it to let Brenda know that she’s not even allowed to question Dan’s revelations and edicts lest she sound like an idiot to her new family. Even Brenda’s own father presumed to have the final say about Brenda’s desire to leave Idaho to go to BYU. He relented pretty quickly, but he still felt the need to remind everyone that he was the decider.

Before the brothers shifted their focus, the Laffertys were apparently not much of an aberration from what could be considered typical for Mormons of the time. Ammon Lafferty, even with his violently controlling tendencies, was considered acceptable in his religious devotion to the point that he and his wife were called to serve a mission for the church. Yes, the brothers shifted from being covert practitioners of unrighteous dominion to being overt and threatening authoritarians, but they were, first and foremost, products of the home, church, and community environment in which they were nurtured. That left Brenda highly vulnerable to the power structure she married into. Much the same thing has happened to many women in similar circumstances, for similar reasons. Don’t believe me? Read on.

  • In the short time since the first episodes dropped on Hulu, I’ve had many friends tell me that they can’t watch the show because of the intense impact they experienced from learning about the Lafferty murders in 1984. I’ve heard this from so many, in fact, that I’ve lost count. Almost  without exception, these are LDS or former LDS women who are near my age, i.e., near Brenda Lafferty’s age, who at that time were living in Utah County and/or attending BYU, and trying to carve meaningful lives out of a seemingly happy but restrictive set of rules and expectations. They’ve mentioned having been very frightened about what the Lafferty murders might mean for the Mormon community in general. They were afraid of being targeted by seemingly faithful Mormon men with hidden agendas, afraid of being condemned by church leaders for being unworthy due to noncompliance, afraid of being judged and chastised by peers and Relief Society overseers at church, afraid of their husbands or sons sliding into the kind of scrupulous-turned-extremist thinking and behavior that the Lafferty family experienced as part of their “normal,” afraid of being trapped in marriages to angry or power-hungry men that they couldn’t escape from, afraid of what would happen to them and/or their kids if they did try to escape, afraid for their eternal salvation and their eternal ties to their families if they walked away from a dangerous marriage. These are not unfounded fears, but rather fears born of experience observing what happens when women try to claim their autonomy within a high-demand religious culture.
  • Conversely, I’m also seeing numerous posts from people who are frustrated by the way the story is framed in the UTBOH series because they feel the fictionalization detracts from the authenticity of the depiction of Mormons (either mainstream or fundamentalist), or because their own lived experience within Mormonism doesn’t fully align with what they’re seeing on-screen. Whenever I see  “Nobody does that” or “Mormons aren’t like that” comments,  I take a deep breath and instead ask myself “What are they really reacting to? What are they seeing that makes them so uncomfortable that they want to discredit this story on its face?” And I have a theory. It goes like this:
    • As Mormons, we are taught that salvation is dependent not just on grace, but on our commitment to achieving “perfection” as it is defined within Mormon theology. Even though we know intellectually that perfection isn’t really possible, we are told to always be striving to hit certain marks, to never cease in our efforts, to endure to the end. We are held – and hold ourselves and each other – to impossible standards, and go to great efforts to show our compliance with the perfection mandate by doing and saying and looking as much like “good Mormons” as we can manage. The definition of “good Mormon” may vary a bit from one congregation to the next, but there’s always the highly visible general church leadership to refer to as the approved model.
    • Part of compliance is to call out deviations from the norm as “falling short” in an effort to inspire people to do better, try harder, to “be ye therefore [more] perfect” than they were yesterday, or five minutes ago.
    • So, since calling-out is part of the thing we were taught to do to help each other on the path to perfection, we get used to doing it even in situations where individual experiences and perceptions will vary because that’s how humans are. When we see something that we are used to interpreting as a social marker (aka a virtue signal), and it doesn’t match what we believe should be the “correct” expression of that, then we become uncomfortable because it calls our own understanding into question.
    • It’s easy to engage in this unwarranted judgment of our peers even after we’ve distanced ourselves from a religion that doesn’t serve our needs any longer. The human need to protect the legitimacy of our own narrative overrides our understanding that there is no one-size-fits-all path through life, even when we are intellectually aware that we’ve been programmed to respond to certain situations in specific ways that would have us deny our own truth.
    • The net effect of this programming is that when we encounter things like dialogue or social behaviors that don’t strictly align with our own experiences in similar situations, our first inclination is to say something like “that’s not accurate” or “who does that – nobody does that” rather than remembering that no two Mormons experience the church or practice their faith in exactly the same way. When we see something on-screen that doesn’t match our own carefully constructed worldview, we can become uncomfortable because – OMG – the rest of the world will see it too, and we don’t want the world to misunderstand who we are or what we believe. Even if we’ve stepped away from orthodox belief, those defenses can flare up in a case of “don’t make fun of my people; if anyone is going to pick on them, it should be me.”
  • Lastly, back to the question of whether DLB should be telling Brenda Lafferty’s story at all, and whether he’s diminished her voice by making the focus of the series yet another white Mormon male. Here’s my thinking (that’s what you’re here for, yes?):
    • Brenda Lafferty’s story, told from her point of view, is a story I would very much like to see. She deserves that. The greatest tragedy in all of this is that her life was cut short before she had the opportunity to chase her dreams, to change her little corner of the world for the better, to tell her own story. In fact, that was the very reason, when you boil it all down, that Ron Lafferty wanted her silenced. He didn’t want anyone to hear anything she had to say, ever. His alleged revelation – yet another self-serving manifestation of a frustrated, entitled, man who was promised everything – sprang from his desire for vindication, for vengeance, for all the slights and disappointments he had suffered. He projected his anger at his brother’s wife, Brenda. She was easily accessible and vulnerable, in a much weaker position than he was, and he manipulated a lot of other people to help him accomplish his objectives. There’s no doubt in my mind that if he had been able to get to Dianna (and maybe the kids, too), he would have considered her life forfeit as well.

Unfortunately, losing Brenda’s voice makes telling her story from her own perspective a daunting task, especially if you want to avoid fictionalization. Brenda’s sister has done heroic work to preserve and honor her memory and the memory of baby Erica, and their story deserves to be documented and told as far and wide as possible. But…

  • DLB has made it clear that his focus for this story is to call out the misogynistic patriarchy that created the culture that allowed and enabled the Lafferty brothers to become Brenda’s murderers. Clearly Brenda sensed danger – she tried to do what she could to keep her family safe from it – and she became a target for her efforts. She’s neither the first nor the last Mormon woman to die because she was considered a threat to the power of the men around her. That is the point, really. DLB talks about his motivations for presenting the story the way he does, including his awareness that women in the church have historically been marginalized, disenfranchised, and disempowered, even while being pedestalized and told their participation in god’s divine plan is essential. Since Brenda can’t speak for herself, presenting the story from Jeb’s perspective instead allows us to see his dawning realization that not only is his knowledge of his own faith naïve, but also that the church’s history and influence on its members has not always been good or even merely benign. He starts to see that he has been unwittingly contributing to the harm. It’s only a matter of time before his proverbial shelf breaks.
